title: MentaI Health Counselor
description:
Nassau Psychology PC is a vibrant, established, well-run, group psychotherapy practice in Nassau County. We're looking for a licensed Clinical Psychologist, Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), or Licensed Marriage Family Therapist (LMFT) to join our team!

We offer healing, hope and possibilities for adults, adolescents, children and couples through psychotherapy and psychoeducation that recognize the value, strengths, and resources of all we serve. We are seeking experienced mental health providers who demonstrate the heart and skills needed to help our valued clients and who want to be a part of a flourishing team. Nassau Psychology helps therapists focus on therapy by taking care of the business side of a clinical practice.

We provide supervision, referrals, marketing, full billing and scheduling services, administrative support, beautifully furnished office suites and a fun and cohesive team of therapists. The Position is fee for service with reimbursement for any late cancellations and no shows. *This opportunity is ideal for the highly skilled therapist who would like to work in a thriving group practice setting while enjoying a full-spectrum compensation package including competitive pay, medical, dental & vision benefits , 401k matching, paid sick leave, professional development funds - - without the work, headaches, or financial investment of running a business.*

As a group, we strive to provide psychotherapy that deepens our clients understanding of themselves and their relationships. To that end, we use psychodynamic, gestalt, and family systems theories to deepen our work. At the same time, we strive to provide quick symptom relief, integrating the use of CBT, mindfulness and other practices in our work as well. We regularly consult with each other on cases and benefit from different perspectives. There are opportunities for peer-consultation, case conference and didactics as well.

**We are currently seeking full-time and part-time licensed therapists for our Wantagh, Cedarhurst, and Rockville Center locations.**

Full-time is considered to be 38 client hours per week including 3 evenings, or 2 evenings and Sunday for those who wish to work on Sunday.

Part-time work is considered to be a minimum of 20 hours per week including 2 evenings.

We are looking for therapists who can see diverse client populations and presenting issues. Experience working with couples is a plus, as well as experience working with children, but not a requirement. Ideal candidates possess the ability to conceptualize a case, understand underlying motivation and use a treatment model to drive treatment.

**Benefits for Licensed Therapists:**

* Medical, dental, and vision benefits for full-time staff
* Reimbursement funds for professional development training / CEU
* Paid Family Leave
* All employment taxes processed by Nassau Psychology
* Workers Comp & State Unemployment insurance provided
* Bi-monthly automatic bank deposits based on all sessions provided during the previous 2 weeks - (no need to wait for protracted insurance reimbursement)
* All credentialing with insurance companies is done by the practice
* All new patients are on boarded by our New Patient Coordinators (all paperwork, forms etc. are completed by our staff) so you can focus on doing therapy
* We have a very steady referral stream of clients to easily fill your caseload
* All billing of insurance is handled on your behalf
* Feel at ease in well-appointed therapy rooms
* Weekly consultation group
* Opportunities to offer supervision
* Dedicated clinical support and group consultations
* Thriving and connected professional team with year-round social events, sharing each other's successes and milestones and professional growth opportunities

**Minimum Requirements for Licensed Therapists:**

* Master's degree and independent professional license in New York State (including Licensed Mental Health Counselor, Licensed Clinical Social Worker and Licensed Clinical Psychologist).
* Availability for afternoon / evening work is helpful. Weekend availability is a plus. Part-time or full-time work available.
* Currently, we are not considering applicants who are an Associate or Provisional level of license.
* Enrollment on insurance panels is welcomed, but not required.

**For more information about our practice, you can visit our website:**

www.nassaupsychology.org

To apply, please forward a cover letter of interest and resume to the email linked to this posting. You will then be emailed a list of questions - and your responses will help us determine the next steps in our process.

Nassau Psychology is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $32.50 - $52.50 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* What is the best email address to contact you?
* Which current license do you have?

- LCSW, LMHC, LMSW, MHC-LP?

Ability to Commute:

* Cedarhurst, NY (Required)

title: Director of Finance
description:
**About LION Charter School**

  



Leaders In Our Neighborhood (LION) Charter School’s mission is to develop the character of each student. We unite students, families, and staff in helping each individual achieve their best academically, and in sports, the arts, and service to the community. We believe that passion for learning, self-discovery, leadership, and social conscience are the foundation for success in college and fulfillment in life.

  



We believe that all children, regardless of their neighborhood, race, or income, are gifted with distinct talents to offer the world and that school is a place for students to develop the skills and mindsets needed to become their best selves. Furthermore, we assert that human beings are more complex than annual data points and that the fulfillment of a person’s life correlates not simply to test scores but even more so to their relationships with others and the content of their character. With our family partnership and character approach model, we focus on helping students develop their character and the skills they need for life through rigorous academics, self-discovery, and family involvement.

  


**Summary**

  



LION Charter School seeks a professional, experienced, and highly qualified Director of Finance with excellent interpersonal and organizational skills to lead the finance team and support LION’s 200+ faculty and staff members. The ideal candidate will be highly detail-oriented and have the ability to think critically and strategically about their work at both a micro and macro level. A broad range of finance functions are included in the person’s responsibilities and are summarized below.

  



Their primary responsibilities include: overseeing all financial operations, budgeting and forecasting (including management and Board reporting), and external reporting. The successful candidate must be an excellent communicator, be well organized, flexible, and enjoy a fast-paced school environment. The expectation is that they build productive work relationships with other staff, peers, and members of the senior leadership team.

  


**Key Responsibilities**

  



Experience in handling a wide range of responsibilities and the capacity to work independently are essential. Demonstrated expertise in the following areas is required:


* Collaboratively identify strategic priorities and partner with senior leaders to construct budgets that support these priorities
* Create timely and accurate financial forecasts and budgets on a monthly and annual basis, including providing monthly reporting to the senior leadership team
* Design analytic tools to examine revenue and expense trends and patterns to inform key decisions by the senior leadership team
* Research, develop, and implement systems and processes to enable causal analysis and dissect budget variances at a granular level
* Critically evaluate monthly financial results and proactively communicate with with relevant senior leaders
* Collaborate with senior leadership team to develop and regularly examine division budgets and spending trends
* Maintain and provide oversight of financial procedures and policies
* Evolve financial processes to leverage collaborative, sustainable platforms and programs
* Lead the annual audit process
* Ensure timely account reconciliations, including accounts receivable and payables, are current and accurate
* Perform closing procedures monthly, quarterly, semi-annually and annually
* Lead the annual job offer process in partnership with Human Resources
* Critically analyze and approve financial statements
* Collaboratively create a monthly reporting package for the Board of Trustees that includes an informative dashboard enabling the Board to understand key issues and trends
* Prepare and oversee all aspects of financial compliance, including all external reporting: e.g., NY State Education, SUNY, bank (financing)
* Collaborate with the Director of Development and others to prepare fiscal grant management reporting
* Work with auditors to prepare tax filings

  


**Qualifications**


* A bachelor’s degree is required; a master's degree (in a related field such as accounting, finance, or business) and/or CPA is a plus.
* A minimum of 5-10 years of finance leadership experience in non-profits, preferably at a charter school
* An advanced level of proficiency in Excel and Google Sheets
* A passion for urban education and a commitment to LION's mission
* A solid non-profit accounting background, including GAAP expertise (2-3 years)
* An unquestionable sense of confidentiality and discretion in all activities
* An ability to manage highly sensitive work with the highest degree of integrity, honesty, professionalism, diplomacy, and tact
* An ability to inspire, build trust and establish rapport quickly
* An ability to be self-reflective and to seek and receive feedback
* Intellectual curiosity and motivation to grow professionally and help others
* An innate drive to understand processes and operations, a continuous improvement mindset, and a genuine desire to serve others
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* The ability to take on special projects, work independently, and exercise sound independent judgment
* A team-oriented work style
* Outstanding written and verbal communication and organizational skills
* The bandwidth and flexibility to multitask in a fluid environment
* Able to adapt to evolving priorities while maintaining a high degree of work quality
* The ability to handle pressure, maintain timelines, and meet deadlines
* Excellent technology skills – including accounting systems, Google Suite, MS Office
* Experience with the FundEZ or similar accounting platforms is a plus

  
Primary Location LION Charter School Salary Range $110,000.00 - $150,000.00 / Per Year Shift Type Full-Time

We are currently seeking fee for service employees, part time and full time hours available. Work as few as two hours or as many as 40 hours a week. Our dynamic team values collaboration and utilizes the team approach to create a supportive and positive work environment. We value our employees and offer highly competitive rates, $80.00-$85.00 an Hr. for licensed clinicians, $65.00 an hr. for LAC/ LSW level clinicians and $35.00 an Hr. for behavioral assistants (bachelor's degree required). Supervisor roles available for certified supervisors. \\*\\*\\*\\*Per Diem AND Employee/Salaray positions available with PTO & health insurance options available. **Free clinical supervision** towards licensure available for clinicians (LSW's, LAC's) working 20 hours or more. Clinical supervision is available for clinicians working less than 20 hours for a competitive fee. Regular free CEU opportunities. Free supervision towards RPT (20+hrs a week) for those seeking Registered Play Therapist credentials. An additional feature, unique to our practice, is you will never be alone or unsupported. You will be thoroughly familiarized with procedures & policies at start. Afterwards, you will have access to a network of staff immediately available to you to help address any challenges or concerns.

. Responsibilities:

* Provide services based on individualized treatment plans including individual therapy, play therapy, and applied behavioral analysis therapy.
* Behavioral interventions and behavioral management.
* Counselor will use evidence based practice/interventions to provide counseling to children/adolescents in accordance with their needs.
* Document all activities according to GNCC reporting system.
* Accurately complete time logs and written progress reports.
* Create a safe, comfortable and professional work environment at all times.
* Attend monthly staff meetings.

Requirements:

* Excellent communication skills-written and verbal.
* Bachelor’s, LAC, LSW, Degree or higher required.
* **Must have Licensure for Licensed position: LCSW, LPC, LMFT**
* Driver’s License and registered vehicle.
* Willing to travel.
* Dependable, creative and enjoys helping others.
* Ability to prioritize projects and strong problem solving skills.'

title: Cloud Architect
description:
We have **long term contract role** for **Cloud Architect** role for **Princeton, NJ - Onsite from day1.**

**Job Title: Cloud Architect**

**Location: Princeton, NJ - Onsite from day1**

**Job Description:** 

In this role, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and overseeing cloud computing strategies. This includes cloud adoption plans, cloud application design, and cloud management and monitoring. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with cloud services and architecture, ensuring the company’s cloud strategy is aligned with its business goals.

Responsibilities

* Develop and implement cloud strategies to align with business goals and ensure efficient cloud operations.
* Develop and implement a comprehensive cloud strategy that aligns with the organization's business goals and objectives.
* Identify opportunities for cloud technology to drive innovation and competitive advantage.
* Design scalable, secure, and resilient cloud architectures using best practices.
* Select appropriate cloud services (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) based on business requirements.
* Ensure cloud architecture supports high availability, disaster recovery, and performance optimization.
* Lead the deployment and configuration of cloud infrastructure and services.
* Oversee the migration of on-premises applications and data to cloud platforms.
* Ensure smooth integration of cloud services with existing IT infrastructure.
* Implement cloud security best practices to protect data and applications.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).
* Develop and enforce cloud governance policies and procedures.
* Monitor cloud infrastructure performance and availability.
* Identify and address performance bottlenecks and optimize resource utilization.
* Implement cost-management strategies to optimize cloud spending.
* Develop and implement automation scripts and tools to streamline cloud operations.
* Use Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation) for provisioning and managing cloud resources.
* Work closely with development, operations, and security teams to ensure seamless integration and operation of cloud services.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to team members and stakeholders.
* Collaborate with vendors and service providers to evaluate and select cloud solutions.
* Stay updated with the latest cloud technologies, trends, and best practices.
* Continuously evaluate and improve cloud architecture and processes.
* Participate in training and certification programs to enhance cloud expertise.
* Design and implement disaster recovery plans and business continuity strategies.
* Ensure regular testing and validation of disaster recovery procedures.
* Maintain detailed documentation of cloud architecture, configurations, and procedures.
* Provide regular reports on cloud performance, security, and cost metrics.

Qualifications we seek in you!  
Minimum Qualifications / Skills

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
* Minimum 15 years of experience in IT operations, with at least 5+ years of experience in cloud architecture and engineering, with expertise in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Strong understanding of cloud architecture principles and best practices.
* Proficiency in cloud services, tools, and technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Experience with IaC tools (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation).
* Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools (e.g., CI/CD pipelines, Jenkins).
* Strong knowledge of cloud security, networking, and storage solutions.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $60.00 - $65.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* IT: 1 year (Required)
* Azure: 1 year (Required)
* Cloud architecture: 1 year (Required)
* Google Cloud Platform: 1 year (Required)

description:
**About us**

STEAMpark is a NJ-based 501(c)(3) that provides children with afterschool and summer learning experiences steeped in science, tech, engineering, art and math. Its mission is to give educational, emotional and wellness support to children with holistic programs that offer equity and inclusion and a focus on building marketable skills in safe spaces when school is out. STEAMpark programs include project-based lessons that promote digital literacy and reading/math fluency, and healthy meals through partnerships with food banks.

- Support students in their academic, social, and emotional development with online gradebooks and google classroom

- Facilitate project-based learning activities and engage students in learning experiences

- Provide guidance and supervision during homework help, playtime, and dinner

- Utilize classroom and behavior management strategies to create a positive and inclusive learning environment

- Connect with parents at pick-up time and family celebration events

- Experience/certification in teaching elementary and/or middle school is a must

title: Membership Development Specialist
description:
**Job description**

Concierge Choice Physicians (CCP) is a national healthcare marketing and service company that has supported physicians and patients in concierge medicine programs for two decades. Membership medicine is a fast growing niche in the healthcare marketplace, and we have successfully grown along with it, serving as one of the industry’s largest service providers.

The Membership Specialist role requires an individual with great patience, a kind phone voice, and an attention to detail. On a daily basis you will provide support to existing members across the country who need our assistance with their membership. You will also get to work with other departments across the company to support the work we do as a team. You will grow to be a great support resource across many teams including data, marketing, sales, and more.

**General Responsibilities**

* Handle incoming customer/client requests
* Handle outgoing mailings to clients & potential clients
* Make outbound calls to customers in follow-up to inquiries
* Reviewing open accounts for collection efforts
* Contacting delinquent accounts
* Collection follow up via phone, email or written correspondence
* Report billing issues and identify disputes with the accounting team
* General office & sales support
* Support other teams as an additional set of hands as needed

**Required Skills**

* Must have an energetic and kind phone voice
* Must be a team player willing to lend a hand whenever necessary
* Self-motivated, interested in taking on greater responsibility over time
* Detail oriented, tracking all communications within our systems
* Good sense of humor and engaging personality a plus
* Must be able to think on your feet and adapt to different situation with ease

Please submit your **cover letter and resume** for consideration for this position.

Learn more about us at www.ccpmd.com

title: Endoscopy RN
description:

title: Supervisor, Measurement PMX Lift
description:
**Company Description**  

Publicis Media harnesses the power of modern media through global agency brands CJ, Performics, Publicis Collective, Publicis Health Media, Spark Foundry, Starcom and Zenith. A key business solution of Publicis Groupe ([Euronext Paris FR0000130577, CAC 40], Publicis Media's digital-first, data-driven global practices deliver client value and increase growth in a platform-powered world. It is present in more than sixty countries with over 23,000 employees worldwide.

 **Job Description**  

Publicis Media Exchange (PMX) launched a new Advanced TV (ATV) practice. This practice combines the scale and expertise of Publicis Media with the data and technology of Publicis-owned Epsilon and strategic media partners to offer cross-channel video planning, execution, and measurement. The offerings within PMX Lift includes products around Addressable TV, and Over-The-Top (OTT) video.


PMX Lift is dedicated to supporting the sales/growth/demand of the PMX Lift product. To accommodate the increased demand and launch campaigns, the PMX Lift team is adding to our measurement department.


We are looking for an accomplished Supervisor of Measurement and Analytics, to join the growing team and help guide all aspects of implementing PMX Lift campaigns, with a focus & expertise on local campaigns.


On top of invaluable experience in the fast-growing, evolving ATV landscape, you will have the chance to work across a variety of client brands/markets and the opportunity to collaborate with different teams of experts.


You will be a working knowledge of media measurement and understanding of local versus national campaigns.


This is a hybrid role, requiring three days in-office each week. If you are contacted for an interview, your recruiter will discuss specifics with you, inclusive of any necessary reasonable accommodations.

**Your Impact:**

* Reports to VP Measurement & Analytics, PMX Lift
* Engagement with important teams to assist with Local Campaign reporting
* Working knowledge of advanced TV and its outputs
* Working knowledge of advanced attribution measurement such as attitudinal studies, foot traffic, and transactional across ATV and CTV environments
* Partnership with of post campaign reporting data
* Participation in campaign measurement planning and feasibility analysis
* Participation in measurement projects and evolution of products

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor's degree required
* 4 years of experience within an agency or media
* Background in Advanced TV, including Addressable TV, DDL, or OTT
* Experience preferred with Advanced TV platforms (examples including: Ampersand, Dish, Warner/Xandr, NBCU AdSmart, Viacom Vantage, Vizio, Samsung, and Roku)
* Understanding of Traditional and digital media data
* Mine data for applicable insights

  

**Additional Information**  

Our Publicis Groupe motto "Viva La Différence" means we're better together, and we believe that our differences make us stronger. It means we honor and celebrate all identities, across all facets of intersectionality, and it underpins all that we do as an organization. We are focused on fostering belonging and creating equitable & inclusive experiences for all talent.


Publicis Groupe provides robust and inclusive benefit programs and policies to support the evolving and diverse needs of our talent and enable every person to grow and thrive. Our benefits package includes medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401K, as well as parental and family care leave, family forming assistance, tuition reimbursement, and flexible time off.


If you require accommodation or assistance with the application or onboarding process specifically, please contact USMSTACompliance@publicis.com.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $70,000 - $110,000. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 10/21/2024.

title: Guest Services/Front Desk Agent
description:
GUEST SERVICES/FRONT DESK AGENT - Full Time  
Hilton Pearl River  
500 Veterans Memorial Drive  
Pearl River, NY 10965  
www.hiltonpearlriver.com

**Hiring Rate: $16.25-$17.25**

Hilton Pearl River, a full-service luxury hotel located 25 minutes from New York City in Rockland County (NY) and bordering Bergen County (NJ), is seeking an energetic, and personable Guest Service Agent. If you share our passion for delivering hospitality where details matter, apply today to join our team!

Hilton Pearl River remains an innovative forward-thinking hospitality leader by offering best-in-class products, services, and amenities to ensure that every guest feels cared for, valued and respected. As our Guest Services Agent, you would responsible for providing attentive, courteous and efficient service to all guests during check-in, throughout their stay, and at checkout, while maximizing room revenue and occupancy. Candidates must be able to work any shift, and day including weekends and holidays.

Specific Job Knowledge, Skills, and Ability:

* Greet customers immediately with a friendly and sincere welcome. Use a positive and clear speaking voice, listen to and understand requests, respond with appropriate action and provide accurate information such as outlet hours and local attractions
* Complete the registration process by inputting and retrieving information from a computer system, confirming pertinent information including the number of guests and room rate
* Promote Hilton Hotels and Resorts and brand marketing programs. Make appropriate selection of rooms based on guest needs. Code electronic keys. Non-verbally confirm the room number and rate. Provide welcome folders containing room keys, certificates, coupons and refreshment center keys as appropriate
* Verify and imprint credit cards for authorization using electronic acceptance methods. Handle cash, make change and balance an assigned house bank. Accept and record vouchers, traveler’s checks, and other forms of payment. Convert foreign currency at current posted rates. Post charges to guest rooms and house accounts using the computer
* Promptly answer the telephone using positive and clear communication. Input messages into the computer. Retrieve messages and communicate the content to the guest. Retrieve mail, small packages and facsimiles for customers as requested
* Close guest accounts at the time of check out and ascertain satisfaction. In the event of dissatisfaction, negotiate a compromise, which may include authorizing revenue allowances based on the Make it Right program
* Field guest complaints, conducting thorough research to develop the most effective solutions and negotiate results. Listen and extend assistance in order to resolve problems such as price conflicts, insufficient heating or air conditioning, etc.
* Remain calm and alert especially during emergency situations and heavy hotel activity. Plan and implement detailed steps by using experienced judgment and discretion
* Comply with attendance rules and be available to work on a regular basis
* Perform any other job-related duties as assigned by management

Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. *Disclaimer:* this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, Hilton Pearl River reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity and at its sole discretion.

Education:

* High School diploma or equivalent
* Previous work as a GSA desired but not required
* We are an E-verify employer. Only those eligible to work in the United States need to apply

Experience:

* Basic mathematical comprehension to understand and interpret numbers as they apply to operations in the hotel
* Ability to read, write, speak and understand the English language to communicate effectively with guests and team members
* Ability to effectively deal with internal and external customers, some of whom will require levels of patience, tact, and diplomacy to defuse anger, collect accurate information and resolve conflicts
* Ability to stand and move throughout the front desk and continuously perform essential job functions
* Ability to analyze information and make effective judgment.
* Ability to access and accurately input information using a moderately complex OnQ computer system
* Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
* Must be extremely responsible with integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion
* Must be able to work a flexible schedule that includes weekends, nights, and holidays…this is a MUST.

Compensation and Benefits:

* Compensation package
* Hilton Team-Member Travel Program benefits
* Benefits after 30 days include sick & holiday pay, company-paid life insurance, option to enroll in medical plan, dental and vision plans
* Benefits after one year include vacation time and 401K participation

Please email resume and cover letter. Only those candidates with the requisite skills will be contacted.

About the Hilton Pearl River

Hilton Pearl River is a third-generation family-owned and operated Hilton franchise built in 1988. The hotel is located on 17 wooded acres in the scenic Hudson River Valley, just 25 minutes from New York City, and has built and maintained a reputation for consistently exceptional service. The hotel consistently is awarded TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence award and has been ranked #1 in "Overall Service" of all Hiltons in New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut for nine of ten consecutive years. The property features 150 newly renovated guest rooms, restaurant, bar, and recreation facilities, as well as over 20,000 square feet of unique and flexible meeting and event space, and an experienced team of professionals committed to excellence.

title: Administrative Receptionist
description:
Alpha Auto Group ("AAG") is a growing and nationally focused auto dealer group based in Toronto, with various locations across Canada and the USA. AAG’s mission is deeply rooted in delivering best in class service for our valued customers by putting our customers first through world class service.

In order to meet this mission, it’s important that the successful candidate bring a high level of service, skill, willingness to grow and collaborate and drive, set and meet goals, both personally and collaboratively.

title: Assistant Director (CO) Level 3-SUD Center of Excellence, MPA Opiod Settlement *Grant Funded*
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description

* Oversee SUD Outpatient Staffing Expansion initiative and quality improvement efforts within the 10 H+H SUD Clinics and five OTPs
* Implement SUD/OTP patient-centered clinic workflows to enhance quality of services rendered
* Oversee H+H SUD service recruitment, including Peer Counselors, Clinicians (Social Workers, Addiction Counselors, and Mental Health Counselors), Administrative Staff, and Medical Providers
* Facilitate SUD/OTP Clinic workgroup meetings, including agenda setting around recruitment efforts, workflow and billing enhancement, and SUD Access to Care progression
* Oversee SUD Outpatient Staffing Expansion initiative related data, reporting out to internal/external stakeholders
* Develop and track SUD Outpatient Staffing Expansion related metrics, informing quality improvement
* Support SUD/OTP Clinic budget modification requests, working closely with the OBH Director of Fiscal Affairs to facilitate requests
* Collaborate with SUD/OTP Clinical/Administrative leads and CO Revenue Cycle to optimize billing workflows and revenue
* Support SUD/OTP Clinic Electronic Medical Record (EMR) requests, collaborating with EMR (EPIC) analysts and clinic leads to assist with go-live
* Provide coaching to SUD/OTP clinic staff around programmatic, EMR, and billing workflows to assist in service optimization
* Participate in behavioral health/SUD departmental and interdepartmental meetings
* Provide project management support on additional SUD projects and other duties as assigned by supervisor or departmental leadership
* All other duties as needed

Minimum Qualifications

1. A Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in Healthcare, Hospital, Public or Business Administration, Industrial/Organizational Psychology, Organizational Behavior or a related discipline and three (3) years of full-time experience planning, developing and monitoring programs, systems and/or procedures in support of administrative management initiatives, one (1) year of which must have been in a responsible managerial or supervisory capacity; or

2. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university in disciplines, as listed in “1” above and four (4) years of full-time experience, as outlined in “1” above, two (2) years of which must have been in a responsible managerial or supervisory capacity; or

3. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience.

Department Preferences

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and other Requirements:

* Hospital organization, administration and standards, regulations and laws applicable to hospital operations. Knowledge of principles of business and personnel administration, management functions and support service functions
* Project management experience
* Possession of a valid license and current registration to practice in a mental health field issued by the New York State Education Department (NYSED) preferred

How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

*If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.*

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $69,706.00 - $85,000.00 per year

* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account

* Paid time off

title: OR Circulating Nurse
description:
Position Title: Registered Nurse - Circulator/Scrub  
**Supervisor: Director of Nursing**

**Supervises: None**

***Mission and Values:***

*In the performance of one’s job, the employee reflects the Company Mission by participating in the provision of convenient cost-effective, quality surgical care.*

*Values: Confidentiality*

*Quality*

*Teamwork*

*Trust*

*Respect*

***Job Summary:***

*Utilizes the nursing process to provide comprehensive nursing care during the peri-operative phase. Coordinates total patient care in coordination with other health team members particularly the Center’s team. Functions as a patient advocate utilizing the Patient’s Bill of Rights. Demonstrates professional growth and development by accepting responsibility and accountability for one’s nursing practice.*

***Key Areas of Responsibility:***

*A. Assessment*

* *Competency to assess the physiological health status of the patient.*
* *Verifies the operative procedure using the consent form, the patient’s statement and if needed the surgeon’s verification prior to procedure.*
* *Notes the condition of the skin for rashes, bruises, lesions, and previous incisions.*
* *Determines mobility of the body using the patient’s statement, range of motion, and the history and physical.*
* *Reports deviation of diagnostic studies such as lab or radiology reports.*
* *Checks pre-operative vital signs upon admission to surgery: blood pressure, pulse, respirations, and temperature.*
* *Notes nutritional status such as patient has been NPO.*
* *Verifies allergies to medication, food, or chemicals.*
* *Communicates and documents physiological data to other members of the surgical and health care team in verbal or written report, including data which might be relevant to discharge planning.*
* *Competency to assess the psychological health status of the patient/family.*
* *Elicits patient expectations of care and outcome of surgery.*
* *Determines level of knowledge and ability to understand, such as language barrier and seeks assistance as necessary.*
* *Identifies philosophical, religious, and cultural beliefs concerning the intraoperative phase, such as blood transfusions, disposition of limbs, and sacraments.*
* *Communicates and documents psychological data to other members of the surgical and health care team in verbal and written report, including data which might be relevant to discharge planning.*

*3. Formulates nursing diagnosis based on health status data.*

*B. Planning*

* *Competency to establish realistic and attainable goals based on nursing diagnosis and to develop a plan of care based on nursing actions to achieve patient goals.*
* *Provides positioning aids during the intraoperative phase to prevent skin breakdown or impairment of the nervous or vascular system.*
* *Provides equipment to insure patient safety in regard to electrosurgery and laser.*
* *Coordinates use of supplies and equipment for intraoperative care.*
* *Organizes nursing activities in logical sequence, prioritizing nursing actions.*
* *Coordinates patient care needs with other members of the surgical and health care team.*
* *Assigns activities to appropriate personnel based on their qualifications and patient needs.*
* *Maintains required certifications (CPR) and performs effectively in an emergency situation.*
* *Communicates and documents patient’s plan of care to other members of the surgical and health care team in verbal and written report, including that which might be relevant to discharge planning.*

*C. Implementation*

* *Competency to implement nursing actions in transferring the patient according to the plan of care.*
* *Confirms the patient identity using bracelet and patient’s statement.*
* *Selects appropriate personnel for transport as determined by patient acuity and number of staff needed.*
* *Determines appropriate and safe method of transport.*
* *Provides for emotional needs during transport.*
* *Communicates and documents method of transport.*
* *Competency to participate in patient/family teaching.*
* *Participates in pre-operative teaching as needed, such as explanation of surgical routine and environment.*
* *Communicates and documents patient/family teaching.*
* *Competency to create and maintain a sterile field.*
* *Uses principles of aseptic technique in varying situations, such as infection control practices, skin preps, demonstrated knowledge of clean vs. sterile.*
* *Initiates corrective action when breaks in technique occur.*
* *Maintains sterility while opening sterile items for procedure, including pouring solutions.*
* *Inspects sterile items for integrity of package, sterile indicator and/or outdate prior to delivery to the field.*
* *Adheres to dress code policy for peri-operative area(s).*
* *Monitors suite to ensure that movement around the sterile field is appropriate at all times.*
* *The R.N. circulator duties include being in the OR suite during the intra-operative phase.*
* *Communicates and documents maintenance of / compromise of sterile field.*
* *Competency to provide equipment and supplies based on patient needs.*
* *Anticipates needed equipment and supplies, utilizing the surgeon preference card.*
* *Selects equipment and supplies in an organized, timely and cost-effective manner throughout the peri-operative phase.*
* *Assures all equipment is functioning before use.*
* *Operates mechanical, electrical, and powered equipment according to manufacturer’s instructions and the Center policy.*
* *Removes malfunctioning equipment from service, tags it appropriately and initiates repair.*
* *Uses supplies judiciously and in a cost-effective manner.*
* *Communicates and documents provision of equipment and supplies including charges.*
* *Competency to perform sponge, sharps and instrument counts.*
* *Follows policies for sponge, sharps, and instrument counts.*
* *Initiates corrective action when a count is incorrect.*
* *Communicates and documents results of counts according to policy.*
* *Competency to administer drugs and solutions as prescribed.*
* *Administers medications according to policy.*
* *Communicates and documents administration of medications and solutions according to policy, including medication errors.*
* *Competency to physiologically monitor the patient during the peri-operative phase,*
* *Assists/monitors physical symptoms, behavioral changes, intake and output, and vital signs.*
* *Initiates nursing actions or obtains physician order as appropriate, based on interpretation of physiological data/changes.*
* *Communicates and documents patient’s physiological response to other members of the surgical and health care team in verbal or written report, including that which might be relevant to discharge planning.*
* *Competency to monitor and control the environment.*
* *Controls the environment to provide ultimate patient care, such as temperature of room, sensory stimuli, and traffic and noise level.*
* *Adheres to all safety policies and procedures.*
* *Maintains appropriate traffic pattern in the peri-operative environment.*
* *Adheres to sanitation policies for infection control including confine and contain and waste disposal.*
* *Communicates and documents environmental controls or breaks in technique promptly and appropriately.*
* *Competency to respect patient’s rights.*
* *Demonstrates awareness and practices according to the Patient’s Bill of Rights and Center policy.*
* *Provides for patient safety and maintains patient confidentiality.*
* *Communicates and documents provision for patient’s rights as appropriate.*

*D. Evaluation*

* *Competency to perform nursing actions that demonstrate accountability.*
* *Exercises safe judgment in decision-making.*
* *Demonstrates flexibility and adaptability to changes in nursing practice.*
* *Responds in a positive manner to constructive criticism or recommendations for improvement.*
* *Demonstrates tact, understanding and good guest relations when dealing with patients, visitors, team members, and other units.*
* *Practices within ethical and legal guidelines.*
* *Seeks opportunities of continued learning.*
* *Communicates and documents nursing actions.*
* *Competency to evaluate patients.*
* *Develops outcome criteria and measures degree of achievement.*
* *Communicates and documents degree of goal achievement to other members of the surgical and health care team in verbal and written report, including that which might be relevant to discharge planning.*
* *Competency to evaluate effectiveness of nursing care.* ***Continuously evaluates the patient’s needs, plan of care, and nursing actions, adjusting the plan as required to provide optimum patient outcomes.***
* *Assesses the patient post-operatively and determines the effectiveness of care to desired patient goals.*
* *Communicates and documents effectiveness of care and results of nursing care to other members of the surgical and health care team in verbal or written report, including that which might be relevant to discharge planning.*
* *Participates in the Quality Improvement Program activities including identification of aspects of care, collection and analysis of data, formulation of recommendations, implementation of an improvement plan and evaluation of the process.*
* *In keeping with the teamwork philosophy, acts as a resource person to other staff.*
* *Adheres to OSHA guidelines for Universal Precautions for exposure to blood and body fluids, using appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE).*
* *Participates in the orientation of new employees, students and approved program participants.*
* *Attends Center staff and unit meetings, and educational opportunities.*
* *Demonstrates flexibility in meeting the needs of the Center.*
* *Follows AORN Recommended Practices and the Center’s policy at all times.*
* *Assists visitors, staff and physicians, utilizing good guest relations.*

*MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:*

* *Current State of New York nursing license.*
* *Current CPR licensure / ACLS.*
* *Required to successfully complete facility-wide competencies and medication administration exam provided.*
* *Demonstrated interpersonal communication skills.*
* *Prior knowledge of surgical instrumentation and peri-operative equipment or ability to learn same.*
* *Requires prolonged periods of standing and walking.*
* *Requires ability to perform lifting and transport of patients; and lifting of instrument trays and equipment weighing up to 40 pounds.*
* *Ability to work with a minimum of supervision and to organize work in order of importance.*
* *Ability to work effectively in stressful situations and in a variety of peri-operative environments.*
* *Requires manual dexterity to operate equipment and handle instrumentation, hearing to understand verbal instructions and near vision to distinguish supplies and instrumentation.*

*WORKING CONDITIONS:*

* *Accountability to OR Supervisor/Director of Nursing with indirect accountability to Management team.*
* *Normal peri-operative environment with exposure to chemical odors, cleaning solvents and other hazardous materials. Must follow established procedures to ensure safety.*
* *Exposure to possible injury when working with electrical equipment and lasers which require care and following proper safety procedures.*

*Based on the OSHA guidelines for protection against exposure to Hepatitis and HIV, this position is described as Category I. This means that this position has exposure to blood and body fluids. Policies are in place for Universal Precautions identifying exposure risks and appropriate barrier protection.*

*The above is intended to describe the general content and requirements for the performance for this position. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements.*

* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account

title: Grades K-4 Teaching Assistant - Queens Gifted & Talented Public School
description:
**Qualifications:**

· Experience working with students between ages of 5 years old to 10 years old

· Background knowledge in social emotional learning and supporting a positive classroom environment

· Minimum of 2 years in college or an Associate Degree

· Working toward a degree in Education (preferred but not required)

**Job Responsibilities:**

· Build rapport with classroom teacher and students in assigned class or classes;

· Support teacher in daily duties including preparing and setting up activities, grading, organizing, and filing;

· Support students in small groups throughout the day in multiple subjects including English Language Arts, Math, and Science;

· Assist and supervise students during recess, lunch, arrival, dismissal, and bus drop-off and pick-up at school; and

· Work as a team to support the needs of the school building and community.

**Development:** 

If hired, candidate will benefit from the following:

· Experience in the classroom with elementary school-aged children

· Experience with teachers and staff working with a range of diverse learners

· Salary: $20.00 per hour

· Schedule: Monday to Friday when students are at school. TAs are eligible for 2 paid sick day and paid federal holidays during the school year. This position does not pay on weekends, non-federal holidays, and on days students are off from school (other than federal holidays).

· Work Location: 28-37 29th Street, 4th Floor, Astoria, NY 11102

· Upon hiring, applicants must meet all DOE hiring requirements. The position is funded by the PTA, not the DOE.

· All interested candidates should email principal@q300.org with an attached resume. For more info on Q300, please visit www.ps300q.org/.

title: Floral Designer
description:
Overview

We are seeking a skilled and creative Floral Designer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for flowers and a keen eye for detail, with the ability to create stunning arrangements that delight our customers. The Floral Designer will play a crucial role in maintaining our store's beautiful displays, providing exceptional customer service, and ensuring that our e-commerce platform is always stocked with fresh and vibrant flowers.

Duties

- Design and create beautiful floral arrangements for customers, including bouquets, centerpieces, and wedding flowers  
- Maintain a clean and organized workspace, adhering to safety standards and following established procedures for flower care and handling  
- Assist with inventory management, including ordering and receiving supplies, and ensuring that the store's stock is always up-to-date  
- Provide exceptional customer service, answering questions and making recommendations on flowers, arrangements, and related products  
- Operate a point-of-sale (POS) system to ring up sales and handle cash and credit transactions  
- Utilize e-commerce platforms to manage online orders and ensure that customers receive accurate and timely updates on their purchases

- Stay up-to-date with current trends and techniques in floral design and landscape maintenance  
- Participate in visual merchandising efforts to maintain the store's overall aesthetic  
- Communicate effectively with coworkers and management, providing feedback and suggestions for improving store operations  
- Ensure that all sales and transactions are handled accurately and efficiently  
- Maintain a positive attitude and provide excellent customer service at all times

Requirements

- 2+ years of experience in floral design, landscape maintenance, or a related field  
- Strong knowledge of floral design techniques and principles  
- Proficiency in using a POS system and handling cash and credit transactions  
- Excellent customer service and communication skills  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines  
- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills  
- Aesthetic sense and the ability to create visually appealing arrangements  
- A passion for flowers and a willingness to learn and grow within the role

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $16.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 – 55 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid time off
* Store discount

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Holidays
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Floral design: 1 year (Preferred)

* Massapequa Park, NY 11762 (Required)

title: 2025 Summer Analyst – Sales & Trading and Equity Research
description:
**Description**

**Start Date:** May 2025



Citizens Bank is seeking Summer Analysts to join the Sales & Trading and Equity Research teams in New York, NY. Summer Analysts will have the unique opportunity to rotate between the Sales & Trading and Equity Research teams within one of the largest regional banks in the country. Over the course of the 10-week internship program, Summer Analysts will work closely with the teams’ junior and senior professionals to gain significant industry exposure and business insights.



Summer Analysts will split their time between the Sales & Trading team and the Equity Research team, transitioning halfway through the summer program. At the conclusion of the 10-week internship program, high-performing Summer Analysts will be considered for a potential offer for direct employment with the Equity Sales & Trading and/or Equity Research teams (post-graduation).



Job Responsibilities



Key tasks & responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


**Equity Sales & Trading**


* Develop basic understanding of equity sales and trading from the trading desk.
* Coordinate various processes involved in financing and creation of maintenance of trading-related reports and presentations.
* Participate in all facets of trading activities, including private and public offerings across a variety of industry groups; specific focus on supporting corporate brokerage services, including share repurchase programs and at-the-market (“ATM”) offerings.
* Financial Analysis.
* Client and stakeholder interaction and communication.
* Observe/attend daily morning call.


**Equity Research**


* Develop basic understanding of equity research.
* Monitor and analyze daily news and events; build industry knowledge.
* Assist with monthly reporting.
* Work closely with Research Associates and Analysts to maintain files, database and contacts; ensure files are organized and accurate.
* Financial Analysis.
* Client and stakeholder interaction and communication.
* Observe/attend daily morning call.


Qualifications


* Successfully complete a video interview assessment within 7 days of receiving the link. If not completed within the timeframe, your application will be automatically withdrawn from consideration.
* Current students enrolled in an undergraduate bachelor’s program, graduating between Winter 2025 – Spring 2026 **OR** current students enrolled in a graduate program, graduating between Winter 2025 – Spring 2026
* Minimum GPA of 3.2; Preferred cumulative GPA of 3.5
	+ Please include your cumulative GPA on your resume.
* Relevant work experience, leadership experience or coursework in Finance, Accounting or Economics is preferred but all majors will be considered.
* Strong analytical skills and software skills: MS Office application proficiency is required, strong emphasis on MS Excel skills; Bloomberg experience a plus.
* Candidates must currently be a U.S. Resident to be eligible for this program.
	+ Please note that U.S. Immigration sponsorship or work visa is not available for intern / full time Analyst positions and candidates must have permanent authorization to work in the U.S.

**Pay Transparency**



The salary range for this position is $29 - $30 per hour.



Since this a temporary position, you are not eligible to participate in the Citizens colleague benefits program. Accordingly, you will not be eligible to participate in the Citizens health and welfare plans, savings and investment plans, or discretionary award plans or any other Citizens benefit plans or programs, except as otherwise required by law.

  


**Hours & Work Schedule**


* Hours per Week: 40
* Work Schedule: Monday - Friday


*Some job boards have started using jobseeker-reported data to estimate salary ranges for roles. If you apply and qualify for this role, a recruiter will discuss accurate pay guidance.*


**Equal Employment Opportunity**


At Citizens we value diversity, equity and inclusion, and treat everyone with respect and professionalism. Employment decisions are based solely on experience, performance, and ability. Citizens, its parent, subsidiaries, and related companies (Citizens) provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, citizenship, physical or mental disability, perceived disability or history or record of a disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression (including transgender individuals who are transitioning, have transitioned, or are perceived to be transitioning to the gender with which they identify), genetic information, genetic characteristic, marital or domestic partner status, victim of domestic violence, family status/parenthood, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, pregnancy/childbirth/lactation, colleague’s or a dependent’s reproductive health decision making, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.


Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer


Citizens is a brand name of Citizens Bank, N.A. and each of its respective affiliates.

**Why Work for Us**
At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth
*Background Check*


*Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the candidate successfully passing a background check, which may include initial credit, motor vehicle record, public record, prior employment verification, and criminal background checks. Results of the background check are individually reviewed based upon legal requirements imposed by our regulators and with consideration of the nature and gravity of the background history and the job offered. Any offer of employment will include further information.*
company_description: Citizens is where you’ll have the support and training to make an impact and take your career wherever you want to go. Join us today.

title: Vice President Director, Creative
description:
**Company Description**  

Digitas is the Networked Experience Agency, built on the vision that we create magnetic experiences that earn the right for brands to exist in human networks. Today, and tomorrow. We deliver Networked Experiences by leveraging comprehensive data, technology, creative, media and strategy capabilities. Digitas delivers ambitious outcomes via unique solutions that include Creative Experiences, Integrated Media, Addressable Relationships, Social Marketing and Total Commerce. Celebrated by Ad Age as Data and Insights Agency of the Year, U.S Campaign’s Brand Experience Agency of the Year, Media Network of the Year and celebrated by Forrester and Gartner, Digitas serves the world’s leading brands through a global network comprised of more than 5,500 employees across over 65 offices in 43 countries.

 **Job Description**  

We are looking for a creative leader who geeks out on future forward tools like A.I. We need someone who understands both CPG storytelling & brand standards to help maintain quality control as we build out a new A.I. platform for a large global brand. You will be working with both the brand team and our tech team to help ensure this tool is effective and useful for all involved.

 **As a VP/CD you will:**

* Have a proven track record of thinking conceptually and strategically across multiple platforms – character-led storytelling a plus.
* Extensive production experience across TV, digital, social and beyond – and an eye for quality production.
* Understands the wants, hopes, dreams and business goals of a large CPG brand – food brand experience a plus.
* Serve as a bridge between the creative teams and the tech building teams.
* Ensure a high level of creative output from the new A.I. tool we’re building.
* Direct the tech team on the most beneficial outputs of the tool.
* Build relationships internally and externally which enables stakeholders to trust you when taking risks.
* Help lead us into the future.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Four-year degree and at least ten years at a competitive creative agency. Work should include strong brand building, digital and multimedia experience, and a track record of successful creative work along with expertise developing  

cross-channel campaigns.
* Energy, a sense of humor and an open & curious mind (yes, these things really do matter.) So does being straightforward, candid and, above all, respectful – of the work and your peers.
* Awards are a nice bonus, but original breakthrough ideas and real creative problem solving are even better.


Got what it takes? We’d love to hear from you.

 **Additional Information**  

Digitas is an equal opportunity employer.


Compensation Range: $121,000 - $191,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off.” If your requirements fall outside of this range, you are still welcome to apply. The Company anticipates the application window for this job posting will end 10/10/2024.

title: EMT and Security
description:
Want to make your mark? Join Benchmark at Meadow Ridge.


At Benchmark, we impact lives through human connection. We are thought leaders creating quality experiences and inspiring personal growth for all who engage with us. We just happen to imagine, build and manage beautiful, private-pay communities geared toward older adults.


Are you *Called to Care* about your work, other people and making a difference? Do you believe that people and teams are *Better Together* than going it alone? Are you always striving to *Be the Benchmark* by which all others are measured? Then our core values match. Connect with us –and to what truly matters!


Meadow Ridge is the premier life care retirement community in Fairfield County, located on 136 acres in beautiful Redding, Connecticut.


In this unique and enriching environment, we offer Independent and Assisted Living apartment homes, as well as a skilled Health Center where we provide our residents with quality care and services.


Meadow Ridge is currently hiring **Certified EMT**s We would love to talk with qualified individuals about these available shift opportunities that allow for part-time scheduling!

* 3rd shift Monday - Friday 10:30 PM - 6:30 AM
* Weedkend shift coverage
* Per diem

  

The EMT position is an important role for our service to the residents in our Community. When not administering emergency care to sick or injured residents individuals in this role are responsible for fostering an environment of overall safety including securing all doors, checking outside lighting, set residential indicators, radio checks and reporting any/all unusual occurrences.


* Licensed Connecticut Emergency Medical Technician (EMT-B) with a minimum of one (1) year EMT experience.
company_description: Benchmark is committed to its mission of transforming lives through human connection. We hire for passion and train for skill and are dedicated to bringing our core values to life in all that we do.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Date: Sep 9, 2024
Location:
New York, NY, US, 10004
Company: Popular
Workplace Type: Hybrid
**Business Analyst**
====================

**Segment Marketing and Deposit Products**
------------------------------------------



As our Marketing Analyst, you will be an integral part of the Insights, Product & Marketing team, reporting directly to the Manager of Segment Marketing. This is a key role and provides the candidate an opportunity to directly impact the Bank’s deposit and lending pricing, contribute and lead the pricing process end to end, interface with leaders across the Bank, and help foster a data-driven culture with a focus on profitability and performance.


You will have the opportunity to use customer and campaign data to assist in the development of marketing strategies, assess the effectiveness of campaigns, connect directly with senior stakeholders across the Bank as you design campaign reports and dashboards.


**In this position, you will:**
-------------------------------

  

**Pricing**  

* Support the management of the deposit and lending pricing process from analysis to implementation.
* Use competitive information and pricing models to identify trends, track deposit goals progress, evaluate the impact of rate changes on cost of funds, and recommend pricing strategies to the deposit rate setting committee.
* Will need to engage with external consultants and vendors.
* Interpret results of pricing models, apply learning in portfolio and acquisition analytics and analyze impacts to determine success of pricing strategy.
* Monitor and report on demand and performance trends for consistency with profitability and growth targets; monitor market share and competitive intelligence; correlate trends with pricing actions; prepare and present materials for pricing committee and other executive audiences.
* Recommends solutions to improve the pricing process.
* Supports the Product team with product profitability analysis, market trends, pricing, distribution support, policy analytics, and the creation of business cases.
* Compiles and analyzes key performance statistics when required.
* Take ownership and challenge process designs to effectively and efficiently deliver changes.
* Establish appropriate review and assessment of the quality of outputs.
* Prepare visually appealing and actionable presentations for senior management.
* Coordinate with stakeholders to gather business requirements for reporting.
* Assist with the creation of dashboards for management reporting.
  

  

**Marketing**  

* Partner with Insights & Marketing team members to quantify how marketing activities impact lead generation and sales.
* Work with Customer Insights, Marketing and other stakeholders to determine campaign profitability, Return on Investment (ROI), cost of acquisition, and other KPIs.
* Creating reports for internal teams and/or stakeholders.
* Collaborating with team members to collect and analyze data.
* Visualizing data with graphs, infographics and other methods.
* Structuring large data sets to find usable information.
* Crafting presentations and reports based on recommendations and findings.
* Efficiently leverage both qualitative and quantitative resources to understand complex financial situations and present solutions.
* Complete post-mortems and set up campaign goals and tracking based on historical and current data

**Insights**  

* Support the Insights Manager in executing market research projects.
* Assist in the development of survey questionnaires, survey programming, and survey distribution.
* Analyze qualitative and quantitative data to provide insights to support the business units.
* Create reports and dashboards.

**To be considered, you will need:**
------------------------------------


* At least 2 years of relevant work experience as an analyst, data scientist, market researcher or similar role involving analyzing datasets and developing actionable insights from them.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel and Power Point
* Proven ability to work independently, playing a key role in strategic projects with support and guidance, but not requiring intensive supervision.
* Familiarity with data visualization & BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Web Intelligence preferred) and the ability to create comprehensible visualizations of complex information.
* BA / BS in computer science, statistics, business administration, finance, or mathematics or equivalent in work experience
* A background in leveraging market intelligence with respect to the interest rate environment, competitive pricing and rate sensitivities in optimizing product and pricing management is a plus.
* Exceptional organizational skills and an ability to handle multiple tasks to meet extremely tight deadlines.
* Ability to connect the dots and make sense of information across multiple data points upstream/downstream that many not be easily noticeable.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with a high attention to detail.


**Salary Range Information**
----------------------------



Our base salary for this position located in New York generally ranges between $80,000.00 and $92,500.00 annually, depending on business need and on your qualifications and experience. Base salary does not include incentive compensation, commission, or any other type of remuneration or benefits.


**Important:** The candidate must provide evidence of academic preparation or courses related to the job posting, if necessary.

  


ABOUT US


Popular is Puerto Rico’s leading financial institution and have been evolving since it was founded over a century ago. From a small bank it has developed into a large corporation that offer a wide variety of services and financial solutions to our customers, with presence in the United States, the Caribbean and Latin America.


As employees, we are dedicated to making our customers dreams come true by offering financial solutions in each stage of their life. Our extensive trajectory demonstrates the resiliency and determination of our employees to innovate, reach for the right solutions and strongly support the communities we serve; therefore, we value their diverse skills, experiences and backgrounds.


We reaffirm our commitment to always offer essential financial services and solutions for our customers and communities, including during emergency situations and/or natural disasters. Popular’s employees are considered essential workers, whose role is critical in the continuity of these important services even under such circumstances. By applying to this position, you acknowledge that Popular may require your services during and immediately after any such events.


*If you have a disability or need more information about requesting an accommodation, please contact us at* *asesorialaboral@popular.com**.* ***This email inbox is monitored for such types of requests*** ***only****. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed exemptions or reasonable accommodations. Any other correspondence will not receive a response.*

  


**Are you ready for a rewarding career?**

  


**Popular is an Equal Opportunity Employer**  

Learn more about us at www.popular.com and keep updated with our latest job postings at www.jobs.popular.com*.*  

**Connect with us!**

title: F/T Retail Wine Store Supervisor
description:
**F/T Store Supervisor – Lead and Support in Our Dynamic Wine Team!**  
*Passionate About Wine & People? Step Into a Responsible Leadership Role!*

The Wine Cellar Group is seeking a **full-time Store Supervisor** to assist the Store Manager while taking ownership of key responsibilities to ensure the store's success. If you love wine, enjoy leading teams, and are ready for an engaging, hands-on role, we’d love for you to join our team!

**Why Join Us?**

* **Competitive Salary:** $18.83-$21.08 per hour, based on experience.
* **Full-Time Role:** 30 hours per week with full benefits, including Paid Time Off (PTO), health care plans (medical, dental, vision), and prescription coverage.
* **Employee Discounts:** Get generous discounts on wines you love—who wouldn’t want a discount on their favorite bottle?
* **Leadership Development:** You’ll work closely with the Store Manager, gaining valuable leadership experience while being responsible for the day-to-day success of the store.

**Store Hours:**

* Sunday-Monday: 11am-8pm
* Tuesday-Wednesday: 11am-9pm
* Thursday: 10am-9pm
* Friday-Saturday: 10am-10pm

**What You’ll Do:**

* **Assist the Store Manager:** Support the Store Manager in overseeing all aspects of store operations while stepping into key leadership duties.
* **Be Accountable:** Lead the team in opening and closing procedures, customer service, and managing inventory. You’ll handle weekly reports, stock management, and store merchandising, ensuring everything runs smoothly.
* **Hands-On Leadership:** This role involves physical work, including unpacking, lifting, and repacking 40+ lb boxes regularly. You’ll also train and lead staff while maintaining the store’s presentation.
* **Lead by Example:** Be a visible presence on the floor, assisting customers, guiding staff, and creating an enjoyable shopping experience.
* **Drive Store Success:** Take charge of daily operations, managing staff schedules, sales targets, and inventory to keep everything on track.

**What We’re Looking For:**

* **Retail Management Experience:** At least 2 years of experience in a retail environment is required.
* **Wine Knowledge:** A passion for wine and a desire to learn more.
* **Flexibility:** Ability to work days, nights (until 10pm), weekends, mid-shifts, and holidays.
* **Team Leadership:** Strong communication skills, a team-oriented attitude, and the ability to lead by example.
* **Physical Stamina:** Must be able to lift and move 40+ lb boxes regularly and be on your feet for 8+ hours a day.

**Join Our Team!**  
This isn’t just a support role—you’ll be entrusted with responsibility and accountability while assisting the Store Manager in leading the team. If you’re passionate about wine, enjoy hands-on work, and want a leadership role in a growing company, we want to hear from you!

Apply with a cover letter letting us know why we’d be a great fit together. Visit www.thewinecellargroup.com to learn more about our company and culture.

We are seeking a highly organized and experienced Assistant Practice Manager to oversee the daily operations of our medical practice. The Assistant Practice Manager will be responsible for helping with managing administrative tasks, supervising staff, and ensuring efficient and effective practice management.

- Oversee the day-to-day operations of the medical practice, including scheduling, billing, and medical records management  
- Implement and maintain systems and processes to improve practice efficiency and effectiveness  
- Supervise and provide guidance to staff, ensure management trained and performing their duties effectively  
- Collaborate with medical providers to develop and implement policies and procedures for patient care

- Coordinate with external vendors, such as insurance companies and suppliers, to ensure smooth operations

title: Instructional Aide/Paraprofessional
description:
Are you searching for a sense of purpose and a career that is rewarding in itself? Let Collier Youth Services be the intersection of meaning and fulfillment in your career. Join our community and transform the lives of at-risk children!

Since 1927, Collier Youth Services has been devoted to the mission of serving at-risk and PROMISING children, youth, and families. Our programs have developed over the years in response to the changing needs of the young people and families we serve. Today, Collier Youth Services is a non-profit that addresses the therapeutic and social issues of our youngsters through educational, residential, and recreational programs of the highest quality. Using a holistic approach, Collier provides at-risk youth support and care. While our services continue to evolve, one thing remains constant: our commitment to nurturing the potential of each person and honoring their individual worth.

~~~

Collier Middle & High Schools, both highly respected alternative programs for students benefitting from a more personalized and therapeutic learning environment, are seeking caring and skilled Paraprofessionals/Instructional Aides.

We offer programs within our Middle School/High School such as The S.T.A.R. program (Skills Training and Retention) which is a two week therapeutic intensive program tailored to Collier High School and Middle School students who are highly motivated to be at Collier, but have difficulty reaching or maintaining the standard of behavior and attendance expected at the school.

We also have openings in our Kateri Program that specializes component of the Collier High School. Here, students engage in a highly individualized learning experience that blends intensive therapeutic services with academic challenges, career exploration, community engagement, and enjoyable recreational activities. Within our small, safe, and nurturing community, students identify and address their unique social, emotional, and behavioral challenges as they develop the skills to function successfully in a complex adult world.

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist teacher and provide extra support to students with disabilities
* Provide instructional assistance individually or in a small group
* Encourage, coach and assist students with emotional, academic and personal growth
* Assist with any other projects and activities as needed, which includes transporting students

**Qualifications:**

* NJ Standard Teaching Certification, a plus
* Must have experience working with classified students with diversified needs and differentiated instruction
* Experience with positive behavioral support, a plus
* Must have a Substitute Certification or willing to obtain a substitute certification by demonstrating proof of 60 college credits
* Valid driver’s license
* Sincere desire to work with children and promote personal growth
* Excellent interpersonal skills and able to work well under pressure

EOE

\\*Retired teachers are welcomed and encouraged to apply! Working for us does not interfere with pensions from public schools.

Pay: From $33,000.00 per year

* 401(k)

* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

License/Certification:

* NJ Teaching Certification (Preferred)
* NJ Substitute Certification (Preferred)
