title: Quality Control Inspector - Aerospace
description:
**Quality Control Inspector - Aerospace** 

Banner Metalcraft Inc is currently seeking an experienced Quality Control Inspector, for precision sheet metal and machining. The candidate will need to perform QC Inspections and checks during manufacture of products. Inspect material, parts and products at different stages of production; in-process, first piece and final inspections. Record inspection results.

**Essential Functions:**

* Identify and control all nonconforming products.
* Perform first piece and in process inspection of sheet metal / machined parts, weldments, and assemblies per mylars, blueprint, manufacturing plan, customer’s specifications and requirements.
* Document inspection results in accordance with company procedures, manufacturing plan, and any additional work instructions.
* Perform First Article Inspection to SAE AS9102 Standards and Customer’s requirements. Familiarity with net inspect quality management module is a plus.
* Final inspection of product as follows:
* Visual and dimensional inspection of end product to applicable mylars, blueprints, manufacturing plans, and Sales Order requirements.
* Review data package traceability (material certifications, inspection reports, test reports, process certifications, etc.) as required by Quality System and Sales Order for legibility, completeness and to verify conformance to blueprint and Customer requirements.
* Ensure that First Article reports required by Sales Order are provided with the data package for the order.
* Verify that all operations required by the manufacturing plan are complete and properly signed off.
* Verify 1st Piece Inspection.
* Understanding and working knowledge of AS9100 (a plus)
* Computer Literate (MS office)
* Completion of any special Customer required forms or data package requirements.

**Job Type**: Full time

**Salary:** Competitive based on experience, steady overtime is available.

**Education:** High School or equivalent, Trade school a plus

**Experience:** 

· Inspection experience within the defense/ aerospace manufacturing industry.

· Computer Literate (MS office)

· Proficiency in blueprint/schematic reading

· Romer Arm/PC- DMIS experience a plus

**As an ITAR compliant company must be Eligible to work in the USA**

**Benefits**

Banner Metalcraft offers a comprehensive benefit package, vacation, and sick/personal time.

company: Glen Cove Child Day Care Center Inc
description:
At Glen Cove Child Day Care, we’re dedicated to providing a nurturing, safe, and stimulating environment for young children. Our mission is to support each child’s growth and development while building a strong foundation for their future. We are seeking a passionate and experienced Toddler Room Teacher to join our dynamic team.

**Job Description:** We are looking for a warm, enthusiastic, and skilled Toddler Room Teacher to create a positive learning environment for our toddlers. The ideal candidate will be responsible for planning and implementing age-appropriate activities, fostering a supportive and inclusive atmosphere, and ensuring the overall well-being of the children in their care.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Curriculum Development:** Plan and execute engaging, developmentally appropriate activities and lessons that promote physical, emotional, and cognitive development.
* **Classroom Management:** Create a safe, organized, and stimulating classroom environment. Maintain positive behavior management and encourage social interaction among toddlers.
* **Child Assessment:** Observe and document children’s progress, behaviors, and developmental milestones. Provide regular updates to parents and caregivers.
* **Health and Safety:** Ensure the health, safety, and cleanliness of the classroom. Adhere to all daycare policies and state regulations.
* **Communication:** Build strong, supportive relationships with children, parents, and colleagues. Communicate effectively with parents about their child's progress and any concerns.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work collaboratively with other teachers and staff to maintain a cohesive and positive team environment.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** High school diploma or equivalent required. Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree in Early Childhood Education, Child Development, or a related field preferred.
* **Experience:** Previous experience working with toddlers in a daycare or educational setting is highly desirable.
* **Certifications:** CPR and First Aid certification required (or willingness to obtain upon hire). Child Development Associate (CDA) credential is a plus.
* **Skills:** Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to create and maintain a positive and engaging learning environment. Patience, creativity, and enthusiasm are essential.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary
* Health, dental, and vision insurance
* Paid time off and holidays
* Professional development opportunities
* Supportive and friendly work environment

* Greet incoming patients in a professional and timely manner
* Work together in a team environment

title: Operations Associate
description:
**Summary:** The Branch Operations Associate provides support to the Branch Leader with the day-to-day store operations including sales growth, safety, customer service and inventory control. The ideal candidate is customer-oriented and has excellent problem-solving skills.

**Job Duties and Responsibilities:**

· Complete all warehouse activities such as, receiving, storing, picking, shipping materials and inventory control.

· Transports incoming and outgoing materials to designated areas utilizing appropriate tools/vehicles to accomplish task including but not limited to hand dolly, forklift, electric dolly, and/or pallet jack.

· Inspect cylinders for defects/test date issues to ensure compliance with government/company policies.

· Responsible for the safe loading and unloading of all full and empty cylinders and hard goods.

· Ownership of the entire customer experience. This includes appropriate product selection and accurate order entry and maintenance

. Perform research and attend manufacturer-based training to understand the specifications, features, and benefits of our product offering.

· Understand, agree, and commit to the safety guidelines and behaviors set forth through our organization and comply with all process standards including wearing personal protective equipment when required

· Cleans and maintains company vehicles on a regular basis and when necessary.

· Occasionally make deliveries while following all vehicle state laws and driving in a safe manner

· Plan trip logistics and obtain necessary documents to transport goods.

· Ensure material is secured properly and compliant with safety requirements.

· Perform pre-trip, en-route, and post-trip inspection of vehicle (if applicable)

· Manage bills of lading

· Performs other related duties as assigned by management.

**Required Skills:**

· Exceptional customer service skills. Ability to manage difficult customer situations with professionalism and courtesy

· Must be a clear and articulate communicator

· Demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks and manage time efficiently

· Ability to work independently

· Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness in all aspects of the job

· Ability to adapt to a changing work environment

· High level of organizational skills

· Must be a self-starter and proactive

* Frequently required to walk.

* Frequently required to lift/push/carry items 50lbs unassisted and above 50 pounds with assistance.
* Occasionally work in high, precarious places.
* Occasionally work around fumes, airborne particles, or toxic chemicals.
* Continually exposed to outside weather conditions.
* Frequently exposed to very loud noises (example: Tanks banging to the floor).
* Frequently use specialized equipment, machines, or vehicles such as Forklifts, pallet jacks and motor vehicles.

On-the-job training, full benefits package that includes: medical, dental, Vision, paid vacation/sick/personal time off, paid Holidays, 401(k) retirement plan with company match, and much more.

title: Medical Front Desk Receptionist
description:
If you’re looking for a rewarding career that contributes to helping people restore their active, pain-free lives, consider joining the Kayal Orthopedic Center team. We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Full Time Medical Front Desk Receptionist based in Kinnelon, NJ.

This is a full time position Monday - Friday 8:00am - 4:30pm.

**Summary:** Responsible for greeting patients, relaying incoming telephone calls to the appropriate person, and performing assigned medical administrative responsibilities by performing the following duties.

**Duties and Responsibilities** include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

* On the designated time each day, ensures the readiness of the reception area, and ensures that the front desk activities are fully operational.
* Greets patients and schedule, cancel and reschedule patient appointments for routine office visits, consultations, treatments and follow-ups using computer system.
* Re-verify all medical insurance information and scan insurance card into system.
* Check for correct insurance billing address on patient’s insurance card and update system accordingly. (look for correct PO Box or a note from the benefits verifier stating the correct address has been entered into system already).
* Enter necessary changes on computer to update information.
* Collects co-pays and reminds patients of past due balances on day of office visit.
* Confirms patient appointments.
* Documents and notifies Physical Therapist or Chiropractor when a patient cancels an appointment.
* Answers incoming telephone calls on a multi-line telephone system in a professional manner.
* Transfers calls to the appropriate person and tasks messages in accordance with approved telephone procedures.
* Operates standard office equipment to include multi-line telephone, answering machine, photocopy machine, adding machine, and calculator.
* Tasks computer hardware/software issues to IT Director.
* Adheres to all approved policies, procedures, and philosophies.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.
* Treat all patients and co-workers with dignity and respect.

**Skills**

Oral and written Communication

Customer Service and diplomacy

Organization, planning and professionalism

Time Management

Computer Literacy

**Education/Training**

Degree: High School Diploma or Equivalent

**Experience**

Must be bilingual and have prior medical front office experience.

description:

Brooklyn, NY

We are an Amazon Delivery Service Partner looking for smart, motivated, Step van experienced and hardworking professionals to fill driver positions! If you enjoy solving problems, enjoy driving, and like great benefits (paid time off, healthcare, savings). Come join our growing family and read on!

**Description**

Amazon Delivery Service Partner for package delivery

1 -2 years delivery driver experience needed!

Apply today to schedule your in-person interview with . We're making on the spot job offers! (All job offers contingent on meeting eligibility requirements.)

**Responsibilities**

* Drive a delivery step van to drop off Amazon packages to customers within their community
* Work about 4-5 days a week, a working day is about 10 hours, One weekenday is mandatory.
* Follow strict safety standards on and off the road
* Interact with Amazon customers and the public in a professional and positive manner

* Must accept text messages from Company managers and other authorized Company employees regarding your schedule, performance, and other Company matters on your personal cell phone

* Must be at least 21+ years old
* Must have a valid driver's license within the state of employment
* Must be able to operate and navigate a delivery van, GVWR 10,000 lbs. or less
* Must be able to move boxes up to 50 lbs., with or without reasonable accommodation
* Must consent to a drug screening
* Must have good communication skills and the ability to work well with customers

* Be CUSTOMER OBSESSED!! We strive to deliver packages and smiles to our customers.

Frequently asked questions

**Do you need a commercial driver's license (CDL)?**

NO, CDL is NOT required

**Can I choose how many hours I want to work every day?**

Delivery drivers are full-time jobs, requiring 40 hours a week. Part-time positions are available as well.

No, logistics will provide delivery vehicles.

**What is an Amazon delivery service partner?**

QDPP is an Amazon partner providing a small parcel package delivery capability to customers every day. As an employee of QDPP, you will work directly for us operating out of an Amazon delivery station located in Brooklyn, NY.

title: Nurse Practitioner
description:
**Position Overview:**

Reporting to the facility medical director and working in collaboration with the attending physician and other Providers, the nurse practitioner is responsible for, but not limited to, the following duties:

**Essential Functions:**

· Be familiar with and perform in adherence to CMS and NYS DOH requirements for the provision of physician services to and medical management of nursing facility patients.

· Provide medical management for geriatric and non-geriatric nursing facility patients including primary care, management of acute illness, and transition of care.

· Coordinate behavioral health services for individuals with maladaptive behaviors.

· Collaborate with attending physician with assigned patient case load.

· Participate in cross coverage for absences of other team members.

· Participate in swing shift coverage and off-site telephone coverage on a rotational basis.

· Perform medical assessment for new admissions and readmissions and write orders for required medications, treatments, diagnostic studies and other necessary care and treatment.

· Perform required medical visits based on patient need, facility policies and regulatory requirements.

· Write timely orders and progress notes.

· Initiate referrals for consultant and specialty services as required and write orders for services needed.

· Write orders for rehabilitation services.

· Participate in advance directives planning with the resident and representatives and write related orders.

· Participate in care planning, discharge planning process and write related orders.

· Facilitate the emergency discharge of residents to acute hospitals as well as planned discharges for medical treatment

· Participate in interdisciplinary rounding and meetings.

· Provide medical leadership for team-coordinated Quality Assurance Performance Improvement initiatives

Minimum Qualifications:

1. A valid New York State license and current registration to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse; and

2. Current certificate as a Nurse Practitioner issued by the New York State Department of Education; and

3. A current certification issued by the State Education Department to prescribe medication.

**Facility / Departmental Preferences**

· Post Acute Short Term Care and Geriatric experience.

· Experience with Post-Acute EMR (PCC)

· Familiarity of CMS and NYS DOH regulations regarding medical management of nursing facility patients

title: General Manager
description:
The NOW Massage offers a space to escape the daily pressures of life and recharge your energy and spirit through the healing benefits of massage therapy.

We focus on delivering a spa experience but eliminate the exclusivity and cost of a traditional day spa. We say show up for yourself so you can better support others. Our commitment to quality services starts with hiring the best Managers, Massage Therapists, and Experience Guides.

The NOW, where all the elements are aligned with nature and form the ultimate zen space, is the ideal environment for healers and empaths. Our culture is one of positivity, respect, and teamwork that supports your growth and career in a relaxing, nurturing environment.

**Brand Truths**

LIVE IN THE NOW

Be Present. Take time to recharge and reconnect within.

KINDNESS IS MAGIC

Positive energy always. Create a circle of warmth and compassion from welcoming guests to giving back to your community.

CARE FOR THOSE THAT

CARE FOR OTHERS

Foster an environment where team members feel valued, recognized, and rewarded.

AUTHENTICITY ALWAYS

Open and transparent communication with our inner circle and guests.

**Why NOW**

* Competitive compensation
* Bonus pay
* 401K plan
* Paid time-off
* Career growth opportunities
* Aesthetically inspiring work environment
* Team member discounts
* A positive, empathetic, and supportive team and company
* Employee Assistance Program offering free counseling, legal & financial consultation, work-life assistance, and crisis intervention services for all our team members and their household family members
* An environment where diversity is celebrated

**Job Summary:**

The General Manager is responsible for the leadership and mentoring of the Experience Guide, Massage Therapy, and Management teams while overseeing seamless operations of the business.

Foster a culture that embraces The NOW brand truths – LIVE IN THE NOW, KINDNESS IS MAGIC, CARE FOR THOSE THAT CARE FOR OTHERS, AUTHENTICITY ALWAYS

**Responsibilities:**

* Maintain meaningful, positive relationships with your team and guests.
* Recruit, interview and hire team members.
* Train and champion team members growth through feedback and acknowledgment.
* Works side by side with your team leading by exemplary example.
* Resolve guest issues and employee relations in a manner reflective of brand truths.
* Adhere to budget and financial goals.
* Document and deliver performance management as needed.
* Develop goals and guide team members in goal achievement.
* Manage inventory.
* Ensure compliance with health & safety standards, and massage therapy laws.
* Perform basic accounting duties, such as recording daily cash flow.
* Monitor and prepare payroll in coordination with accounting department.
* Build and maintain team schedules to maximize productivity and efficiency.
* Collaborate with Leadership Team to ensure best practices and foster innovation.

**Requirements:**

* Experienced in operating a fast-paced, high-volume environment.
* Ability to be efficient and detail-oriented with strong skills in day-to-day operations.
* Possess enthusiasm, empathy, and top tier guest service skills for both internal and external guests.
* Proven track record in sales and building a recurring guest base with a sense of community.
* Excellent communication, listening, and computer skills.
* Must be a team leader and enjoy mentoring people.

**Pay:**

* $45K to $50K

**Reviews:**

* “LOVE LOVE LOVE THE ENERGY!! So many growth opportunities! So much flexibility! Love the benefits! I feel so blessed to be around what I can call, my new family!”
* "Love the team that I work with, love all the locations that we have now and the fact that we are growing[...] Growth in the company is amazing and our corporate office has all the team in their thoughts. Benefits are amazing and always growing and learning!”
* “Wonderful and supportive coworkers. Company offers great benefits for management. The boutique has great energy, talented massage therapists, an exceptional front desk team.”
* “Everyone is treated with respect. There is always a very supportive environment [...]The culture revolves around positivity and catching people doing extraordinary things. They honestly think about us.”
* “We are encouraged to be proactive and use our voice & collaborate to implement change. The team is extremely talented and open to sharing their knowledge to elevate the team as a whole. The environment itself reminds me to take deep breaths and be present!”
* “I found The NOW to be a great work experience. The culture is authentic and caring. They truly embrace diversity and inclusion…”

Trabajar en Sodexo es más que un trabajo; es una oportunidad de ser parte de algo más grande. porque creemos que nuestras acciones diarias tienen un gran impacto. Pertenecerá a una empresa y un equipo que le valoran por ser usted; actuará con propósito y tendrá un impacto a través de sus acciones diarias; y podrá prosperar a su manera.

* *En general, Sodexo se esfuerza por ofrecer paquetes integrales de beneficios para empleados y descripciones detalladas de los puestos que los candidatos solicitan. Sin embargo, debido a la naturaleza contractual de nuestro negocio, algunas de las funciones laborales y beneficios de los empleados pueden variar según la unidad a la que se postule. Los criterios de elegibilidad y/o ciertos beneficios que se ofrecen a nuestros empleados pueden variar según la unidad, incluido el costo de los beneficios y su disponibilidad. Pídale a su entrevistador información adicional específica de la ubicación durante el proceso de entrevista, como sus funciones laborales y los beneficios para empleados que se ofrecen en la unidad.*

 **Lo qué hará:** como un Cashier/Food Service Worker Sodexo, también dará una cálida bienvenida y hará sonreír a nuestros clientes. Operará la caja registradora y completará las transacciones con un enfoque centrado en el cliente. Esta función incluye la preparación y servicio de nuestro vibrante menú de café y garantizar que todas las áreas de trabajo se mantengan limpias y ordenadas. Su acogedor servicio al cliente pone una sonrisa en los rostros de las personas y tiene un impacto en sus vidas cotidianas. Únase a Sodexo y sea parte de algo más grande. un equipo donde puedes actuar con propósito y prosperar a tu manera.

  

El Cashier/Food Service Worker trabaja principalmente en la operación del servicio de alimentos, manejando transacciones en efectivo y de crédito de los clientes de Sodexo. Además, ayudarán en la preparación y el servicio de alimentos de mostradores y mesas de vapor. Los deberes incluirán equipos de limpieza y desinfección y estaciones de trabajo. Como cajero, debe operar con precisión la caja registradora/POS y completar las transacciones. También brindará apoyo a la operación minorista, incluida la configuración, el mantenimiento de suministros y productos, y la asistencia en la limpieza y el cierre. Estas responsabilidades pueden diferir entre cuentas, según las necesidades comerciales y los requisitos del cliente.

title: Office Manager/HR Manager
description:
**Job Title: Office Manager/HR Manager**

**Location:** Living Well Balanced, Upper West Side, NYC

**About Us:**

Living Well Balanced is a renowned wellness center dedicated to the Upper West Side community for over 20 years. We offer a range of services, including Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Massage Therapy, Chiropractic, Personal Training, Stretching, and Rock Steady Boxing. Our mission is to provide a collaborative, holistic, and personalized approach to wellness. We are seeking a dedicated and dynamic Office Manager/HR Manager to join our growing team and contribute to our mission of promoting health and wellness in the workplace.

**Position Overview:**

We are looking for a passionate Office Manager/HR Manager with a strong background in both office management and HR management. The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic about fostering a positive work culture, improving employee engagement, and supporting organizational growth. You will play a crucial role in implementing HR policies, managing office operations, and enhancing the overall success of our organization.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Strategic HR Planning:** Collaborate with departments to develop and execute HR strategies that align with organizational goals and support overall business objectives.
* **Onboarding Excellence:** Manage and refine the onboarding process to ensure new hires are effectively integrated into their roles and the company culture.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with managers to foster a supportive, collaborative work environment.
* **Conflict Resolution:** Address and resolve workplace conflicts using professional mediation and effective problem-solving techniques.
* **Employee Relations:** Handle workplace investigations, disciplinary actions, and terminations with fairness, confidentiality, and compliance.
* **Administrative Duties:** Oversee employee data management, attendance tracking, PTO, payroll processing, and maintenance of HR systems.
* **Performance Management:** Conduct interviews and performance reviews, providing guidance to support employee development and organizational goals.
* **Confidentiality:** Maintain strict confidentiality regarding sensitive employee information and workplace matters.
* **HR Reporting:** Provide regular HR updates to stakeholders to keep them informed of developments and metrics.
* **Benefits Administration:** Act as the primary contact for employee benefits (medical, dental, vision), lead benefits presentations, manage enrollment processes, and ensure accurate benefits administration.
* **Policy Support:** Address employee inquiries about company policies and the employee handbook, providing clear and accurate information.
* **Talent Acquisition Support:** Assist with recruitment and onboarding tasks, including job postings, applicant screening, interview coordination, and new hire paperwork.
* **Project Management:** Manage various projects and processes such as salary and bonus reviews, employee engagement initiatives, and ad-hoc projects.
* **Training and Development:** Collaborate with management to assess development needs, deliver training, and support career development.
* **Office Management:** Engage with internal clients to understand business operations and staffing needs, and work with management to develop and implement policies and initiatives.
* **File Maintenance:** Oversee the organization and maintenance of the HR department’s electronic filing system and documentation.
* **Problem Solving:** Utilize critical thinking and problem-solving skills to address challenges and adapt to evolving situations.
* **Communication Skills:** Exhibit exceptional written and verbal communication to effectively interact with employees and convey information clearly.
* **Regulatory Knowledge:** Interpret and apply HR laws and policies to ensure compliance and adherence to best practices.

**Key Requirements:**

* **Experience:** Minimum 2-3 years of experience as an Office Manager and/or HR Manager, preferably in a medical or wellness setting.
* **Skills:**
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in problem-solving, conflict resolution, and disciplinary processes.
* Experience with payroll systems and a solid understanding of HR laws.
* Competency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook).
* **Personal Attributes:**
* Hands-on, self-motivated, and able to work independently as well as in a team.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to thrive under pressure.
* Proven track record of effective collaboration with leadership.
* High energy, flexible, and capable of managing both operational and strategic tasks.
* A person of sound judgment, able to establish credibility and act as a trusted advisor to management.

Pay: $25.00 - $35.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35-40 per week

**Competitive benefits**

We offer incentives to reward your hard work!

Some examples may include:

· Additional PTO days

· Free lunch and/or dinner

· Up to $600 gift cards (Visa, Amazon etc.)

· Complimentary in-house services (Massage, physical therapy, personal training etc.)

* 401(k)
* Health, dental, vision coverage with Employer contribution
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health savings account
* Holiday pay
* Life insurance
* Paid time off

And more!

**How to Apply:**

If you are an enthusiastic professional with a passion for fostering a positive workplace and promoting health and wellness, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and how you align with our mission at Living Well Balanced.

Join our team and make a meaningful impact on our community and employees!

title: Sales Development Representative – Hospitality
description:
We're a new company shaking things up in the restaurant world. We’ve discovered a unique approach that significantly enhances the dining experience. **Our trial run with a Michelin-starred restaurant in NYC showed an astonishing 4,344% increase in bookings within just 2 hours**.

We're extending our Beta in NY and are **seeking 3 SDRs to help us acquire additional test users on a** **1-month project**. You’ll **work remotely at the hours of your choosing** to **invite New York residents & commuters to test our service**. In return, we ask for their feedback to help us improve our platform and the UX.

You will choose one or several of the following target markets:

* **Corporate:** You will schedule appointments with CEOs, Owners, CFOs, Head of Operations, Head of Recruitments, Head of Employee Benefits and equivalents with our Account Executives to invite their company/colleagues to test our service and give us feedback.
* **Social media groups & influencers:** You will schedule appointments with Social Media Group Moderators/Leaders, Influencers and their Management Team with our Account Executives to invite their group members/followers to test our service and give us feedback.
* **Field marketing:** You will be part of a team bringing our offer to the market through creative field marketing sign up tactics, and good ol' fashion grass roots opportunities (aka hittin' the streets!)

**Top of Market Compensation & Growth Opportunities**

For this 1-month project we offer performance-based compensation, where your **earnings are tied to the number of sign-ups you generate**. On top of that, you’ll enjoy **perks like free meals at upscale restaurants**.

To clarify, you’ll have the **freedom to work from home and set your own hours**. We do not monitor or regulate how or when you work. However, please note that compensation is strictly tied to sign-ups—there is **no hourly pay for this 1-month project**. This model rewards those who dedicate at least 2 hours of work per day. On average, dedicating just 2 hours per day can earn you $2-3K, while **working 3-4 hours daily can easily result in $5-8K per month due to the attractiveness of our solution**.

Starting in **October 2024**, top performers will be offered a full-time contract with a monthly base salary of **$8K-$15K** (function of your performance), plus commissions and bonuses, as we prepare for our expansion.

**Please Note:**  
Do not apply unless you have at least **1 year of experience** in a similar role.

title: Regional Sales Account Manager
description:
**About Us:**

We are a well-established and growing, national alternative advertising company based out of Beaverton OR. We are currently looking for a highly motivated, creative minded salesperson to join our team. We have the largest assortments of alternative media networks in the nation and work with brands from national CPG to local and regional healthcare and just about everything in between. The networks we offer provide coverage from tweens, teens, & young families all the way up to seniors and can be catered to just about any demographic category. We are truly able to offer something relevant for almost any brand. This is an opportunity to join an established company with motivated colleagues in a fun work environment that offers opportunity for growth and movement in the company.

**About the Position & Candidate:**

We are looking for candidates to help grow and connect with new agencies and brands across regional sales territories. This is a new business development position; if you are a sales professional and you are looking for a new opportunity - and you are not afraid to pick up the phone and call new prospects - then please contact us! We are looking for a creative minded individual with a strong operational understanding who can take the networks we offer and more importantly the ideology behind the networks and create relevance to brands and agencies alike. This is truly a sky’s the limit position for the correct candidate. Our perfect candidate will be a high energy, intrinsically motivated individual looking to develop and maintain relationships with brands as well as media buyers and planners in their region. This person will be a relentless prospector, proficient account manager, have strong telecommunication, and customer service skills while being able to quickly establish rapport with prospective clients and constantly seeking new clients and opportunities. This person will work well with a team but excels when given an opportunity to take the assets available and think outside the box to constantly create new meaningful ideas and opportunities for brands. title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
The Speech Tree is seeking a full-time **Front Desk Receptionist** in our Princeton Center. The hours are 10:30 am-6:30 pm.

The Front Desk Receptionist is the first point of contact for our clients and families. This role requires excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and a warm, welcoming demeanor. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing the front office, scheduling appointments, handling patient inquiries, and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations of the clinic.

**Responsibility & Details:**

* Welcome patients upon arrival, assist them with signing in and collect insurance information / other required data in a friendly & professional manner
* Distribute intake and new patient forms, as well as policy and legal documents
* Answer phone calls, direct callers to the appropriate party, or address their needs and make reminder calls to patients for upcoming appointments as necessary
* Assist billing and operations manager in communicating with insurance companies.
* Maintain a daily log of attended sessions and processed payments
* Efficiently operate copier, scanner, and printer and manage office supply inventory
* Hours: Monday through Friday from 10:30am - 6:30pm

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent required; additional education in office administration or related field is a plus.
* Previous experience in a medical, therapy, or customer service environment preferred.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and Knowledge of Quickbooks a plus.
* Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively.
* Familiarity with medical billing and insurance verification is a plus.
* Positive attitude, reliable, and punctual.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary
* Paid time off and holidays
* Health insurance (for full-time employees)
* Opportunities for growth within the practice
* A supportive and collaborative work environment

We specialize in working with children with autism, developmental disabilities, and a wide range of speech and language disorders. title: Athletic Director
description:
**The Position**

Five Towns College invites nominations and applications for the position of Athletic Director (AD). The AD provides leadership to the Sound Athletic Department, which offers intercollegiate and intramural athletic programs to the College’s undergraduate students.

The Sound Athletic Department is an independent member of the United States Collegiate Athletic Association (USCAA), having repositioned as a D1 institution following several successful years at the D2 level. The Five Towns College Sound offers M and W varsity-level basketball and soccer. Volleyball will return for the 2025 – 26 AY, and Lacrosse will begin in 2026 – 27. The Sound also offers an E-Sports program within the ECAC.

The Athletic Director is head administrator of athletic programs at the College. The AD represents the College at by the conference and national association levels, while identifying appropriate strategic opportunities to improve and expand athletics at the institution.

Responsibilities include recruiting, evaluating, and recommending the appointment of coaches, assistant coaches, athletic trainers, and game day support personnel; administering to the needs of each team including, without limitation, facilitating the purchase and acquisition of uniforms, equipment, and facilities, coordinating student eligibility, team travel, and game scheduling; assisting with the identification and recruitment of prospective student-athletes; representing the Sound Athletic Department at institutional events; developing relationships with high school athletic programs; maintaining the Department website/page – including posting of statistics and reporting results to the athletic conference and national association; maintain the Department’s social media presence; and such other activities as may be assigned from time-to-time.

**Job Qualifications**

A master’s degree is required, with NYS professional teacher certification in Physical Education (k-12) strongly preferred.

Through their professional accomplishments, the successful candidate shall also display a record of progressive responsibility in high school and/or collegiate athletics, including an ongoing commitment to professional development and student-centered service. He or she shall display a commitment to high ethical standards, tolerance for diversity in all of its forms, and support for the College’s institutional values. Candidates shall be technology literate, including as end-user of the computer software and hardware platforms utilized at the institution as well as by a variety of social media platforms. The Athletic Director is expected to set a tone that encourages all members of the Sound Athletic Department to be actively engaged in the life of the College.

**About Five Towns College**

Founded in 1972, Five Towns College is a private, residential, coeducational, non-sectarian institution of higher education located at Dix Hills, Long Island, NY. The College serves the cause of music, media, the performing arts and business. Additional areas of emphasis including Film and Television, Mass Communication, Interactive Media Arts, Music Education, Court Reporting, and more.

Located on a beautiful 40-acre campus in the center of Long Island, the College is a creative center for learning, which attracts artists and scholars from around the world who seek to be enriched by the unique educational experiences it offers.

More than 90% of the College’s students may be classified as traditional learners who attend the institution on a full-time basis.

Five Towns College offers associate, bachelor, master, and doctoral degrees through four academic divisions and eight departments. Most programs of study begin twice each year, in the fall and spring, following a traditional semester-based calendar. Summer, winter, evening and part-time learning opportunities are also offered. The College delivers classes in traditional, hybrid, blended formats and fully online formats.

The College holds an Absolute Charter issued by the New York State Board of Regents, and its programs of study are registered with the New York State Education Department. The College is institutionally accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE). Its programs in Music and Music Education are accredited by the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM). Its program in Theatre Arts is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Theatre (NAST). Approximately 700 students are enrolled at the College each year, with about 200 residing on campus.

**Apply**

This is an immediate vacancy for a candidate with the ability to join the College during the current semester. Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply with CV/resume and cover letter to employment@ftc.edu. Subject Line: Director of Athletics. Screening will begin immediately and continue until the vacancy is filled.

You can learn more about Five Towns College at www.ftc.edu.

The Glass Guru of Meadowlands is scheduling interviews now for Glaziers/Glass Technicians in East Rutherford, NJ, USA. This is a full time Mon-Fri position.  

  

 If you are a top performer who's been overlooked, disrespected or taken advantage of by another employer, The Glass Guru of Meadowlands might just be the fit you've been looking for.  

  

 The compensation will start at $25-$35/hour based on work experience plus performance bonus, with tremendous potential for increased pay. Other aspects of the compensation package include:  

  

Performance bonuses  

* Company Tablet
* Uniforms Provided
* Annul training for up to $3,000
* Annual Bonuses up to $4,800
* Health, Dental, Vison, Prescription & Mental Benefits
* Paid time off: Vacation Days, Sick Days for the first year
* Paid Federal holidays


  

 Wouldn't it be amazing to work with a team that appreciates you? How awesome would it be to work alongside a team made up exclusively of top performers? What if you worked with a company that actually listened to you? What if your boss showed you respect and appreciation every day? And what if that job gave you the freedom and opportunity to reach out for your personal dreams too?  

  

The Glass Guru is a unique company. We have a mission to provide all of the above to every single person who joins our team. Our company culture is built on Consistent Quality & Excellence Exceeding Expectation of our customers, improving every day, and treating each other fair.  

  

**Why will you love being a part of our team? Here are a few reasons:**
  

* We are growing rapidly and there is plenty of opportunity for rapid advancement.
* We only hire great human beings, so you won’t have to work with jerks, bums or lazy people.
* You will be truly appreciated for your efforts, talent and attitude.
* You can earn a great living. Pay your bills and have some money left over for fun stuff!
* You will grow here, both professionally and personally.

**You can qualify to join our team if...**  

* You are upbeat and positive each day
* You can check your ego at the door and work with a team
* You get a sense of satisfaction after a day of helping people.
* You are tough, mentally and physically.
* You are looking to grow professionally AND personally.
* You are eager to learn and can take constructive criticism without getting offended.
* You love being outside (that includes all the crazy weather conditions we get here…).

 **If you answer “YES” to any of the following statements, please don’t contact us:**  

* You are grumpy in the morning.
* Your favorite place is under the covers in your mom’s basement.
* You are afraid of talking to people (don’t try to fool us on this… we will know right away.)
* You are a victim, a whiner or complainer.
* You smoke at work, you do drugs, or you drink heavily.
* You do blames others rather than take control and come up with solution.


  

 We are an equal opportunity company. It’s all about attitude and hustle at The Glass Guru of Meadowlands. If you are the right person it will not be because of your age, race, or gender.  

  

  

**Roles & Responsibilities:**  

  

The **Glazier / Installer** position is the primary product fulfillment position in the company. Glaziers / Installers are charged with delivering the customer experience in the home as part of the final fulfillment (installation) process.  

  

* Thoroughly inspect job materials, ensuring the product(s) are the correct size & style, and that there is no obvious product damage or flaws on product(s) required to complete job(s)
* Load required job materials to installation vehicle(s), including redundant materials, tools, job folder/paperwork, safety equipment etc...
* Communicate to office AND customer if we'll be late for scheduled installation appointment
* Upon arrival at customer’s home, validate the work to be completed, the product(s) to be installed, installation location(s), and the estimated time it will take to complete the job, and customer expectations, and manage those expectations accordingly.
* Install all products and services included in the work order, troubleshoot, and strive to resolve any installation problems that might occur on-site
* If it's not possible to safely perform a quality service or installation on the date promised, effectively note all issues, and required materials necessary to complete the installation to the customer’s satisfaction at a later date.
* Communicate with relevant team members regarding incomplete work, ensuring that any new materials are ordered, the cause of the go-back can be discerned, and that customer expectations can be managed accordingly.
* Take care of the customer's home/business, ensuring we leave it cleaner than when we found it... use booties, etc...
* Close out the installation by walking customer through the care and maintenance of products, walk them through warrantee (if applicable) and how to contact us if they ever need service or have additional questions

**Qualifications & Educational Requirements:**  

  

* 3 years residential glass installation experience
* HS Diploma or equivalent
* All candidates must pass initial background check and drug test. Valid license to drive, and a clean DMV record
* Candidates must be physically capable of performing work, in good health, with the ability to lift up to 50-100lbs. unassisted

**Preferred Skills:**  

  

* Residential glass replacement including single/double pane window glass, shower enclosures, skylights, etc...
* Residential window/door installation including new construction and retrofit
* Window/door maintenance, weatherization, and repair
* Effective troubleshooting skills
* Excellent verbal/written communications skills
* Microsoft Office proficient (Word, Excel) preferred
* Hardworking, motivated, with excellent organizational and time-management skills


  

* Eligibility for company benefits contingent upon completion of initial employee probationary period and at the discretion of the Franchise Owner.

  

*Glass Guru is a franchise system. Each location is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of that franchise. All inquiries about employment at this franchise should be made directly to the franchisee, and not to Glass Guru Corporate.*

description:
**IMMEDIATE OPENINGS!**


Come for a job and stay for a career! Federal Express Corporation (FEC) is part of the rapidly growing warehouse and transportation sector that helps keep America, and our economy, moving. Be part of a winning team and workplace community that cares about who you are as an individual, and your safety in the workplace.

 **Perks and Benefits at Federal Express Corporation (FEC):**

* Competitive wages beginning at ﻿$17.50 per hour﻿ paid weekly for both full and part time opportunities
* $5,250 tuition reimbursement every year with no lifetime cap! All employees are eligible for this awesome benefit on their first day of employment!
* Generous paid time off program – work your way up to 5 weeks of PTO a year!
* Medical, dental and vision benefits after a short waiting period.
* Flexible scheduling that helps balance your work and personal life.
* Valuable employee discounts on things like cell phone plans, electronics, cars and restaurants.
* Free Purple Pathways career development program for all Federal Express Corporation (FEC) employees.
* Paid parental leave for both moms and dads!
* Employee networks, and diversity, equity and inclusion programs available for all employees.

 **What you can expect at Federal Express Corporation (FEC):**

* Fast paced and physical warehouse work – why pay for a gym membership when you can get paid while working out?
* Warehouse duties include loading, unloading, and sorting of packages of various sizes.
* Part time Federal Express Corporation (FEC) employees work one shift a day; full time Federal Express Corporation (FEC) employees work two shifts.
* Shift lengths vary based on package volume – generally part time employees work between 3 and 6 hours a day. Full time employees can expect to work between 6 and 10 hours.
* Overtime paid after 40 hours a week.

title: Forklift Operator NIGHT SHIFT
description:
**SKC Forklift Operator (NIGHT SHIFT) – Edison, NJ**  

  

About Specialty Kraft Converters  

  

Specialty Kraft Converters (SKC) is a privately owned domestic supplier of insulation vapor retarders and facings. We primarily supply residential building insulation manufacturers with printed and asphalt coated paper substrates. SKC is currently seeking full-time Forklift Operators to join our NIGHT SHIFT. The manufacturing plant schedule is 7AM – 7PM and 7PM – 7AM, 4 to 5 days per week. Ambient temperature could be 95 – 100F during summer months.  

  

What We Offer You  

  

* $19.25/HOUR to start (PLUS $.75/HOUR Night Shift Differential) $20.00/HOUR NIGHT SHIFT to start
* $22.10/HOUR after (90) day probationary period ($22.85/HOUR NIGHT SHIFT)
* Night shift differential
* OT calculated after 8 hours worked daily
* Medical, dental, and vision coverage (90% PAID BY EMPLOYER/10% EMPLOYEE CONTRIBUTION) after completion of (90) day probationary period
* 401k retirement saving
* Life insurance (100% PAID BY EMPLOYER)
* Paid time off plus all major holidays


  

About The Position  

  

The Forklift Operator Position is a starting position with the company. New employees typically work a few weeks on our day shift to train ***before transitioning to night shift***. New employees are trained as forklift operators/machine helpers and work in a support role of the production machine operator processing coated Kraft paper materials and laminations.  

  

New employees who successfully adapt to the work environment, job duties and safety culture of SKC can bid to fill open positions within the company as new opportunities become available.  

  

The work requires physical exertion, the ability to learn and follow instructions, a keen eye for safety, some mechanical ability and a positive attitude. We are a company of dedicated individuals with a sense of urgency who will do whatever is required to supply our customers.  

  

About The Typical Workday  

  

You will keep busy opening raw materials, helping to load the raw materials on the machine, unloading the finished product, cleaning up, changing over to other products and doing what it takes to keep the equipment running. There are periods of down time and intense periods of work. Staying busy is a key attribute to help balance the workflow.  

  

Qualifications  

  

We will train you to drive a forklift, although experience is preferred, and operate various stations of our main production machine progressively. The job requires some heavy lifting (up to 70lbs.), the ability to stand for extended periods of time, bend, reach, stretch, twist and squat. Excellent communication skills and general proficiency with computers are required to manage the process. You must be able to read both a standard and metric tape measure and use it accurately.  

  

Please note: If you are offered employment, it may be contingent upon the successful completion of all background verifications, physical, lift assessment and drug screenings.  

  

EOE, M/F/D/V

title: Full Time Assistant Manager-($20-$22/hr)-Retail/Storage NY34
description:
Company Overview:

Prime Group Holdings is one of the fastest growing private equity real estate firms in the country. We are focused on acquiring and adding value to a growing portfolio of real estate assets located throughout the United States. Our team members are:

* Customer and client focused.
* Self-motivated entrepreneurs who are passionate about what they do.
* Diligent ethical professionals dedicated to creating long-term value for our stakeholders.
* Eager to make a positive difference in the lives of their customers and clients.

Position Overview:

As the Assistant Manager with Prime Storage Group, you will be responsible for assisting in the day-to-day operation of one or more self-storage facilities, including renting units, selling merchandise, interacting with customers, and maintaining the property overall. Our employees are the first line representatives to the customer. The Assistant Manager must have the ability to work face-to-face with customers and build excellent relationships while enhancing your customer service and sales skills and experience.

Job Responsibilities:

* Renting self-storage units, parking space, and other related products.
* Converting telephone and walk-in inquiries into rentals.
* Maintain Account Receivables through the pursuit of collections, posting of payments and processing, and delivery of daily bank deposits accurately and timely.
* Upsell moving products and assist in unit sizing decisions.
* Greeting customers promptly, enthusiastically and professionally.
* Knowing and presenting the features and benefits of the property at all opportunities.
* Resolve customer issues in a timely and effective manner.
* Ensures that company standards of cleanliness and appearance are met.
* Inspect the property, including performing lock checks, keeping the property esthetically pleasing and maintaining interior cleanliness including bathrooms.
* Showing customers our self-storage units.
* Perform other duties as assigned.
* Getting the units “guest ready” for the next person when a customer moves out.

Job Requirements:

* High school diploma or equivalent
* A self-starter in all respects
* A passionate desire for career advancement
* 1-2 years of relevant work experience in a fast-paced, customer-facing environment.
* Retail/Sales experience.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills – both on the phone and in person
* A person who works well independently and in a team setting.
* Have a working knowledge of computer applications (Microsoft Office, Outlook, etc.)
* Possess a valid driver's license and insurance with access to reliable transportation.
* Have the ability and willingness to perform light maintenance such as sweeping, mopping, wiping, lifting (up to 50lbs), operate handheld tools etc.
* Be capable and willing to travel to work in multiple locations in the area as needed.

What Prime Offers:

* A healthy work/life balance; most of our facilities are closed by 6:00 pm and are not open on Sundays.
* Competitive pay and bonus plan
* Health, dental, life, vision, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance
* A 401(k) program with a company “matching” policy
* Paid time off and paid holidays
* Career advancement opportunities

For more information, please visit our website: https://primestorage.com/home-storage

Internal applicants: please reach out to your DM and apply internally.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER STATEMENT

Prime Group Holdings is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description:
Do you love animals? Then you’re halfway there! We are looking for a Veterinary Assistant to care for animals and support Veterinarians and your teammates. You’ll play an important role in bringing comfort to our furry patients and ensuring the smooth running of our facility. One of the most important Veterinary Assistant responsibilities is to ensure all areas are clean, for animals and humans alike. We’ll rely on you to assist the Veterinarian in examinations and operations. You need the ability to care for them properly – that’s one of the most important Vet Assistant job requirements. This includes knowledge of routine tasks, like holding and trimming nails, but also readiness to care for injured or scared animals that might occasionally lash out. If you’re organized, friendly, quick on your feet and dependable, we’d like to meet you.

**Responsibilities**

* Greet clients and guide them through the check-in process.
* Discuss pricing and packages best suited for the clients and their pets.
* Processing electronic and cash payments.
* Weigh pets for accurate record keeping and medication needs
* Restrain animals during examinations or vaccinations
* Soothe upset or frightened animals
* Administer medication prescribed by Veterinarians (e.g. by mixing it with food)
* Observe animal behavior or health condition and report to the Vet
* Help in cases of emergencies
* Handle administrative duties such as calling patients or calling patients in the examination room by priority
* Keep accurate records and logs
* Reassure clients that their pets are being cared for
* Advise pet owners on nutrition and healthcare
* Clean all areas of the clinic thoroughly including, but not limited to, the lab, lobby, exam rooms and relevant outdoor spaces.
* Marketing in local areas around the clinic to increase client traffic
* Gain feedback from clients relating to their visit and asking for referrals and reviews

**Skills**

* Proven experience as a Veterinary Assistant or similar position working with animals
* Experience in an administrative role is a plus (e.g. reception or customer service work)
* Current or former pet ownership is an advantage
* Excellent communication skills in a team based environment
* Patient and caring personality
* Problem solving
* Showing initiative and curiosity to learn and grow
* Ability to follow instructions properly
* Comfortable being around animals (cats, dogs etc.)
* Ability to meet the physical demands of the job (e.g. lift up to 40 lbs)
* Availability to occasionally work in emergencies
* High school diploma; a certificate from a Veterinary Assistant program is a plus

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $15.00 - $17.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: New Patient Care Coordinator Position (Tribeca Physical Therapy)
description:
**Tribeca Physical Therapy is hiring an experienced, part-time employee to serve as a Front Office Patient Care Coordinator for the company’s growing team. Our Patient Care Coordinators are responsible for contributing to the team's efforts by providing amazing customer support from the initial phone call to the final visit and beyond.**  

  

Just a little heads up.  

  

We are looking for someone who wants to be a part of a growing, innovative, people-centered environment and is looking for a career move, NOT just another job.  

  

**This position will begin as Part-Time that may lead to a Full-Time position.**
  

  

You are perfect for this role if you LOVE working with patients, digging deep into issues, learning, and problem-solving. Seriously, you are the type of person who will become obsessed with optimizing patients’ results and the front office experience so they can have a seamless experience when they enter the facility.  

  

You may be someone who can work independently, avoid mistakes, and make decisions on your own. But you are also a taskmaster and enjoy working with a team.  

  

We want someone comfortable with responsibility and very mission-minded. When others see a WALL, you see a problem you can solve given enough time to RESEARCH.  

  

Someone who loves learning and problem-solving. If you’re looking to work for a company that allows you to choose your path of growth as the company grows, then you’d be a great fit! This is a dream job for the right person!  

  

We will teach you everything you need to know! We just need you to show up with a willingness to learn, the ability to do the work, and a positive attitude. **Tribeca Physical Therapy** is looking for a long-term hire. We want to create an amazing working relationship that could help the company thrive for multiple years.  

  

**Requirements**
  

* Bachelor's Degree
* 2-3 Years of Front Desk experience (Required)
* Healthcare Insurance/Billing/Collections Experience (Preferred)
* Sales and Objection Handling Skill Set (Required)
* This position will be performed in a high-volume outpatient environment so need to be able to multitask and problem-solve quickly.
* Flexibility is a must. Need to be willing to make changes as quickly as needed
* Our team prides itself in being just that….a TEAM! So, if we’ve got your back, you’ve got to have ours, too!

**Job Duties for the Administrative Assistant / Front Desk Include (but not limited to)**  

* Front Desk Tasks (computer use, answering phones, preparing reports, statistics tracking)
* Call All Incoming Leads from Online Sources and Facebook Ads
* Schedule New Patient Evaluations
* Check In New Patients and Collect Pertinent Paperwork
* Greet All Patients Like They Are VIPs!
* Check-In / Out all Existing Patients
* Insurance Benefits Check and Authorizations
* Collect Patient Payments
* Schedule Patients Appointments Appropriately
* Have A Lot Of Fun While Making A Difference In Someone's Life!

* Flexibility with your schedule - Who doesn’t want that?!

title: Interior Plant Service- Horticultural Technician
description:
**About us**

Kelly Mac Interiorscapes is an award-winning company providing Indoor Landscape Design, Installation, and Maintenance Services since 1994. Our services also include Holiday Decorating and Green Building features such as Living Walls and Moss Art.

*Interior Plant Service. Horticultural Plant Care Specialist*   
**Join our award-winning Interior Plantscape team!!**

Kelly Mac Interiorscapes is seeking a skilled Interior Plant Maintenance Specialist with a passion for plants and a positive outlook to service our clients in Northern New Jersey.

We are experts in providing care for living plants in corporate and residential environments. We value individuals with good customer service and communication skills; self-motivated with ability to make sound decisions independently.

**Responsibilities:**

* Perform regular maintenance tasks, including watering, pruning, fertilizing, and cleaning indoor plants.
* Monitor plants for signs of pests, diseases, or other issues, and take appropriate actions to address them.
* Conduct regular inspections to ensure that plants are healthy and thriving.
* Install and arrange plants in accordance with design plans and client preferences.
* Maintain accurate records of plant care activities and communicate effectively with the rest of the team.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive pay based on experience and performance.
* Opportunities for training and professional development in horticulture.
* A supportive and collaborative work environment.
* The chance to work with a wide variety of plant species and contribute to the beauty of indoor spaces.

**Requirements:**

* Reliable vehicle with clean driving record is a must.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently
* Proficient with record keeping and communications through mobile phone apps
* Horticultural experience is required.
* Ability to handle rigorous physical workload including bending and lifting.
* Experience with outdoor landscape plants and floral design is a plus.

The position is part-time or full-time. Opportunity for benefits, advancement, and pay increases. Starting pay $21.63/hour or more with experience, plus mileage reimbursement.

**How to Apply:**  
If you are enthusiastic about plants and eager to join a dynamic team dedicated to indoor plant care, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in this position.

Kelly Mac Interiorscapes is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Work Remotely

title: Managed Service Provider vCIO
description:
Our client is seeking for a virtual CIO (vCIO) to join our team. This is a senior IT consultant who


provides strategic guidance, planning, and oversight of IT infrastructure, systems, and processes for our


customers.

  

Essential Job Functions:


Conduct IT assessments and audits to evaluate the current state of IT infrastructure, security,


operations, and governance.


Develop and present strategic IT plans and roadmaps that align with the client's business goals


and objectives and address the identified gaps and opportunities.


Provide guidance and recommendations on IT best practices, policies, standards, and


frameworks.


Organizing and developing benchmarks to show value of service to clients.


Preparing and attending monthly, quarterly, or yearly strategic business reviews with


clients.


Manage and oversee IT projects and budgets, ensuring timely and quality delivery, and


minimizing risks and issues.


Monitor and report on the performance and value of IT services and solutions and identify areas


for improvement and optimization.


Build and maintain strong relationships with the client's executive team, stakeholders, and


vendors, and act as a single point of contact for IT-related matters.

  

Additional Duties & Responsibilities:

* Participation in company projects, meetings, and objectives.
* Ability to travel to client sites as needed.

  

Supervisory Responsibilities:

* This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

  

Demonstrated Competencies:

* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate


complex IT concepts and solutions to non-technical audiences.

* Critical Thinking – Synthesizes complex or diverse information; collects and researches data;


uses intuition and experience to complement data; understands workflows and procedures.

* Job Knowledge – Competent in required job skills and knowledge; exhibits ability to learn and


apply new skills; keeps abreast of current developments; requires minimal supervision; displays


understanding of how job relates to others; uses resources effectively.

* Teamwork – Balances team and individual responsibilities; exhibits objectivity and openness to


others’ views; gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; puts


success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and


objectives; supports everyone’s efforts to succeed.

* Certifications in ITIL, PMP, CISSP, or other relevant IT frameworks and methodologies are


preferred.

  

Education / Experience / Certification Requirements

* College Degree or equivalent is required.
* Customer-service oriented with a problem-solving attitude.
* Excellent written and verbal communications skills
* Proven time management & scheduling abilities

title: Architectural Drafter
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a skilled Drafter who has knowledge of METAL & GLASS to join our team. This role is perfect for those with a passion for interior design, graphic design, and system design.

Duties:

* You’ll have the chance to work on diverse projects, collaborate with a skilled team, and enhance your expertise in architectural glass and metals
* As a CAD Drafter, you will be responsible for developing and modifying detailed technical drawings specific to architectural glass and metal projects
* You will work closely with project managers, engineers, and production teams, ensuring that all drawings adhere to project specifications and quality standards
* Drafting & Design: Create detailed technical drawings using AutoCAD, including plans, elevations, sections, shop and fabrication drawings for architectural glass and metal projects
* Revisions: Update and refine existing drawings to reflect changes in design, specifications, or project requirements
* Team Collaboration: Work closely with engineers, project managers, and production staff to ensure drawings meet project specifications and quality standards
* Quality Assurance: Ensure all drawings are accurate, complete, and compliant with industry standards, focusing on glazing techniques and architectural metalwork
* Engaging Projects: Work on innovative projects that challenge and expand your skills in architectural drafting

Qualifications:

* Proficiency in AutoCAD and other relevant drafting software
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy
* Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities
* Effective communication skills for collaboration with project teams
* Ability to interpret and work from technical drawings and specifications
* Familiarity with glazing techniques and architectural metalwork
* 3+ years’ experience with AutoCAD software
* 3+ years’ experience in Architectural Metal & Glass industries
* Experience in Bluebeam Revu software and Microsoft

This is a fantastic opportunity for a skilled Drafter to join our team and contribute to the success of our company. If you are passionate about design and are looking for a challenging and rewarding role, we encourage you to apply.

description:
**About the Role & Program**


Join the committed team that delivers the top-rated morning show in America – Good Morning America! GMA interns provide production and operation support to the booking, digital, and field and series teams.


Throughout the experience, interns have an opportunity to collaborate with producers, attend editorial meetings and learn the inner workings of show operations.

**What You Will Do**

Required Qualifications & Skills

* Strong writing and research skills
* Shown ability to lead multiple projects simultaneously
* Strong curiosity about journalism and knowledge of GMA’s daily two-hour show

* Major or previous coursework in Journalism, Communications, Media Studies, Film/Television or a related field

description:
**About the Role & Program**


ABC News Newsgathering Operations is responsible for all logistics, transmission and engineering for day-to-day news coverage, as well as special projects! You will rotate between all Newsgathering Operations departments, helping with support functions and learning what's involved with bringing together various technologies to facilitate the telling of news stories from the field. You will be exposed to all areas of field operations; including transmission, field equipment, crew coordination, IP based broadcast solutions as well as supporting live streaming operations for ABC News platforms and products. You will be encouraged to be hands-on, and your responsibilities will increase as you learn throughout the internship (and based on previous experience).

**What You Will Do**

* Rotate between different departments, including the Live Desk, the News Acquisition Center, the Logistics Desk, and Field Engineering. This provides you with a comprehensive view of the entire news production workflow.
* Supporting producers and clients in crafting compelling stories. This involves helping to coordinate the necessary resources, equipment, and personnel for the production process.
* Responsible for booking crews, handling incoming feeds, and tracking equipment. This ensures that the necessary personnel and tools are in place for successful broadcasts.
* Prioritizing and maintaining information in critical systems used for transmission, crew coordination, and equipment tracking. This contributes to the smooth functioning of operations.

**Required Qualifications & Skills**

* A basic understanding of television production

title: Sales Representative
description:
**About Us:**

Alpine Tree Service is a well-established and respected leader in the tree care industry, based in Morristown, NJ. We are dedicated to providing exceptional service and building lasting relationships with our clients. We are currently seeking a motivated and experienced Sales Representative to join our team and contribute to our growth.

**Job Description:**

As a Sales Representative at Alpine Tree Service, you will be integral to expanding our client base and promoting our high-quality tree care services. Although previous experience in the tree care industry is not necessary, a genuine interest in the field and a commitment to outstanding customer service are crucial.

**Training & Certification:**

* **Industry Training:** You will receive comprehensive self-directed training in the tree care industry to familiarize yourself with our services and products.
* **Certification:** During your training period, you will work towards becoming a certified arborist within the first 6 months, gaining valuable industry knowledge and credibility.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Generate Leads:** Identify and pursue new business opportunities through networking, referrals, and targeted outreach.
* **Client Engagement:** Build and maintain strong relationships with potential and existing clients, understanding their needs and offering tailored solutions.
* **Sales Presentations:** Conduct presentations and consultations to explain our services, benefits, and pricing.
* **Business Development:** After initial training and certification, actively build your business by expanding your network and exploring new client opportunities.
* **Market Research:** Stay updated on industry trends, competitors, and market conditions to effectively position our services.
* **Sales Goals:** Meet and exceed sales targets and performance metrics set by the company.
* **Documentation:** Accurately prepare and manage sales contracts, proposals, and other necessary documentation.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in sales with a demonstrated ability to meet or exceed sales targets.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build client relationships.
* An interest in the tree care industry and a commitment to learning about our services.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Proficiency in CRM software and Microsoft Office Suite.

**Desired Skills:**

* Previous sales experience, even if not in the tree care industry, is highly valued.
* Knowledge of local markets and the ability to leverage this for business development.
* A proactive and results-oriented mindset with a passion for delivering exceptional customer service.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive base salary with performance-based commission structure.
* Health and dental insurance.
* Paid time off and holidays.
* Opportunities for professional development and career growth, including arborist certification.
* Supportive and friendly team environment.

**Application Instructions:**

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and enthusiasm for the tree care industry. Send your application to office@alpinetreenj.com with the subject line “Sales Representative Application - [Your Name].”

**Alpine Tree Service** is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Pay: $50,000.00 - $500,000.00 per year

* 401(k)
* Company car

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Paid training

title: Seasonal Retail Sales Associate
description:
Want to work with a product you love? Yankee Candle is seeking individuals who are passionate about home décor and fragrance. We are an energetic, innovative, and engaged team, who values their people and their development. Not to mention, we offer a generous 50% off employee discount on most products.

We characterize our team as a band of avid retail and brand enthusiasts who care deeply about their work, and work hard to get the best possible results. This position is perfect for someone who enjoys an organization that moves swiftly, is open to change, and for someone who really cares about providing and demonstrating exceptional guest service—and can correlate that behavior with driving sales.

Job Summary: - As a Retail Store Sales Associate, under the direct supervision of the Guest Sales Leader you will provide exemplary guest service, execute visual merchandising and operational standards; support the to meet or exceed the stores sales and profitability goals; restock product; operate POS system and mobile POS to process guest purchases; and perform other duties to support daily retail operations.

Minimum Requirements: **Minimum state required age requirement**

Hours: Flexibility in work schedule is required including the ability to work extended hours, weekends, and holidays as operational need may require.

We are an e- verify employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

About Yankee Candle - Yankee Candle is a leading designer, manufacturer, wholesaler, and retailer of premium scented candles, based on sales. Yankee Candle participates in the $25 billion global candle and home fragrance market. Yankee Candle has a 46-year history of offering distinctive products and marketing them as affordable luxuries and consumable gifts. Yankee Candle sells its products through a North American wholesale guest network of approximately 35,000 store locations, a growing base of Yankee Candle owned and operated retail stores, direct mail catalogs, and its Internet website (www.yankeecandle.com). Outside of North America, Yankee Candle sells its products primarily through an international wholesale guest network of over 6,000 store locations and distributors covering over 50 countries on a combined basis.

www.yankeecandle.com

Yankee Candle is subsidiary of Newell Brands - Yankee Candle is part of Newell Brands, a global consumer goods company with a strong portfolio of well-known brands, including Paper Mate®, Sharpie®, Dymo®, EXPO®, Parker®, Elmer’s®, Coleman®, Jostens®, Marmot®, Rawlings®, Irwin®, Lenox®, Oster®, Sunbeam®, FoodSaver®, Mr. Coffee®, Rubbermaid Commercial Products®, Graco®, Baby Jogger®, NUK®, Calphalon®, Rubbermaid®, Contigo®, First Alert®, Waddington and Yankee Candle®. Driven by a sharp focus on the consumer, leading investment in innovation and brands, and a performance-driven culture, Newell Brands helps consumers achieve more where they live, learn, work and play.
