title: Entry-level Private Jet Sales Consultant (Long Island, NY)
description:
**Company Description**  

Do you have a personality and passion for a career in sales and hospitality but have not had the opportunity to break into the luxury travel industry? Are you someone who enjoys connecting with high-net-worth individuals to build long-lasting client relationships?


If so, our Long Island office is searching for their next Private Jet Sales Consultant! Apply today to connect with a member of our recruitment team.

**WHO IS AIR CHARTER SERVICE**


Air Charter Service (ACS) is a leading aircraft charter company that provides passenger and cargo aircraft charters worldwide.


To put it simply, we are the middle person between the clients and the operator. Our Sales Consultants manage the full travel/sales cycle so all our clients have to do is fly! Our clients consist of high-net-worth individuals, CEOs, celebrities, the rich and famous, and many more!


With offices across the globe, including North America, South America, Europe, CIS, Africa, the Middle East, Asia, and Australasia, ACS offers personalized charter solutions using local knowledge.


ACS is a rapidly growing company, generating over $1 billion in revenue and arranging more than 25,000 charter flights annually.

 **Job Description** **A DAY IN THE LIFE**

* Building your list of potential clients by researching internal and external databases, websites and social media
* Pro-actively targeting your list through outbound sales calls, emails and visits (both face-to-face and virtual) and converting them from potential clients in to ACS clients
* Building relationships with Private Jet Operators to ensure we are able to provide the most suitable aircraft choices for the clients’ requirements
* Develop and maintain relationships with clients to ensure repeat business
* Ensure you are consistently exceeding both your sales activity and financial targets
* Confirming company procedures are being followed in a methodical and chronological way to ensure protection of both ACS and the client
* Demonstrate an expert understanding of the aircraft and chartering process
* Managing charter bookings from inquiry to completion
* Flight watching/overseeing flight departures
* Building a wide and effective network of contacts inside and outside the organisation
* Make prompt, clear decisions which may involve tough choices or considered risks

  

**Qualifications** **WHAT DO WE LOOK FOR**

* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent phone etiquette
* Willing to learn and adaptable
* Interest in aviation and sales
* High attention to detail
* Confident individual
* Resilient
* Open to travel
* Client facing
* **Client relationships and client experience background**

  

**Additional Information** **TRAINING & TRAVEL**

* Award-winning professional training and one-on-one mentoring
* Opportunities for international and domestic travel or relocation
* International training based in our London HQ
* Training and travel expenses are covered by the company

**COMPANY CULTURE**

* A dynamic and fast-growing company
* Modern office with luxury amenities in the Galleria Area
* Balance between independent and team-oriented work
* A welcoming, enjoyable, and interactive environment – seasonal events and team night outings
* Flexible start and end time hours
* Future work-from-home opportunities; 1x day a week

**WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU**

* $55,500 USD + 10% uncapped commission
* Clear path for career advancement from Trainee Broker to Director
* Job stability and leadership support of development
* Affordable health, dental, and vision insurance plans through Aetna
* 401K retirement savings plan with generous employer match!
* Life insurance
* Paid maternity/paternity leave
* 20 days to start in vacation time and more earned each year
* Paid sick time
* 12 paid public holidays
* Additional paid leave for your birthday, wedding, moving house, holiday shopping, and more.


Check us out on social media! LinkedIn - Facebook - Instagram - TikTok - Twitter - Youtube


Diversity & Inclusion: Air Charter Service Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

**WHAT ARE THE NEXT STEPS?**


Submit your resume to us today and a member of our recruitment team will be in touch!
company_description: Air Charter Service (ACS) is an aircraft charter company that arranges passenger and cargo aircraft charters worldwide.

title: Server - Cast Member
description:
At CEC Entertainment, we build careers around great food, family, and fun! Our purpose and our passion is to create the best place for kids and families to eat and play!

**Compensation Details**


$15.00 - $16.00 Hourly**Job Description**


Chuck E. Cheese (CEC) is a great place for a first-time job seeker or a place to build an exciting career. Our Cast Members are empowered to provide the greatest service anywhere through cross-training in a variety of different positions. Over 60% of our managers were promoted from within!

**Now Hiring Servers**

**Servers provide great service as they deliver food to the guests.**

**Pay and Benefits:**

* Competitive pay
* 50% discount on meal during shift
* Flexible schedules
* Scholarships
* Perks and Discounts programs
* Employee Referral Program
* CEC Cares Fund (program to assist employees during catastrophes)

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Be at least 15 years of age
* Available to work various shifts
* Excellent customer service skills
* Energetic and enthusiastic personality

**Essential Job Functions and Work Environment:**

* Must be able to lift or carry objects weighing 0-50 pounds during scheduled shift.
* Must be able to stand, bend, kneel, reach, push/pull, walk and squat during scheduled shift.
* In addition to the essential job duties stated above, the ability to handle job stress and interact effectively with others, including guests and co-workers, are essential functions of the job. The work environment includes flashing and flickering lights, moving mechanical parts, and loud noises.

*Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*


At Chuck E Cheese, we care about the safety and health of our guests and employees. We have rigorous health and sanitation standards, and our operational procedures are designed to meet or exceed local requirements and most importantly to protect the health of our teams and guests.


 **#Diversity #Inclusion #Culture**

**The Company;**


CEC Entertainment, LLC ("CEC"), headquartered in Irving, Texas is the nationally recognized leader in family entertainment and dining with its Chuck E. Cheese, Peter Piper Pizza brands and virtual kitchen concept, Pasqually's Pizza & Wings.


As the place where half a million happy birthdays are celebrated every year, Chuck E. Cheese's goal is to create positive, lifelong memories for families through fun, food, and play and is the place Where a Kid Can Be a Kid. Committed to providing a fun, safe environment, Chuck E. Cheese helps protect families through industry-leading programs such as Kid Check. As a strong advocate for its local communities, Chuck E. Cheese has donated more than $19 million schools through its fundraising programs. Peter Piper Pizza features dining, entertainment and carryout with a neighbor-hood pizzeria feel and "pizza made fresh, families made happy" culture.


Peter Piper Pizza takes pride in delivering quality food and fun that reconnects family and friends. Created in 2020, Pasqually's Pizza & Wings offers a distinct, customized eating experience outside of a restaurant environment that amplifies classic pizza and wings and operates out of 400 ghost locations nationwide. The Company and its franchise operate a system of nearly 600 Chuck E. Cheese and more than 120 Peter Piper Pizza venues, with locations in 47 states and 17 foreign countries and territories. For more information, visit chuckecheese.com, pasquallyspizza.com, and peterpiperpizza.com.

**Benefits:**


CEC Entertainment offers a wide variety of benefits including medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and 401(k) retirement savings plan to eligible U.S. employees as part of their overall employment package. We also offer job training and career growth opportunities. Chuck E. Cheese is a "Work Today, Get Paid Tomorrow" employer.


\\* \\* \\*


At CEC Entertainment, we believe that our workforce should reflect the diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of many guests we serve. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ancestry, color, genetics, gender identify, gender ex-pression, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, veteran status, or on the basis of any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Check-In Clerk & Caller (Bilingual SPN/ENG)
description:
**About us**

Live Through Rec. is an innovative and effective program that is committed to the development, growth, and success of young people through the use of recreation, sports, fitness, and active engagement.

We are seeking a highly organized and reliable individual to join our team as a Check-in Clerk and Recruiter. In this role, you will be responsible for efficiently managing the attendance of program participants and ensuring effective communication with the program director. Additionally, you will play a vital role in maximizing class enrollment by reaching out to potential participants through phone calls.

* Greet and check-in program participants upon their arrival, ensuring accurate attendance records are maintained.
* Communicate attendance information promptly and accurately to the program director.
* Assist participants with any inquiries or concerns related to the check-in process.
* Maintain a systematic record-keeping system to track participant attendance and program data.
* Collaborate closely with the program director to address any attendance or enrollment-related issues.
* Contact potential participants through phone calls to promote program offerings and maximize class enrollment.
* Maintain a friendly and professional demeanor while engaging with participants and potential leads.
* Provide exceptional customer service by addressing participant inquiries, providing program information, and resolving any concerns.

* Strong organizational and time management abilities.
* Attention to detail and accuracy in record-keeping.
* Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.
* Proficient in using computer systems and software for data entry and administrative tasks.
* Experience in customer service or a related field is preferred.
* Previous experience in managing attendance or enrollment processes is an advantage.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.
* Friendly, approachable, and professional demeanor.

This is a part-time position with morning-day shift hours on Saturday and remote work on Friday during the day. Occasional Friday work may be required based on program needs. If you are a motivated individual with excellent organizational skills and a passion for providing outstanding customer service, we would love to hear from you.

Thank you for your interest in joining our team.

title: Elementary School After School Program Education Specialist
description:
**SUMMARY**

The Harriman After School Program is a SONYC after-school program that runs during the school year. Under the supervision of the Program Director, the Education Specialist oversees and directs the planning, organizing, and implementation of education services for children in the after-school program. These services contribute to the increased social competence in children and the recognition and enhancement of parents as the primary educators of their children. **Education specialist must have BS or higher and be an experienced teacher.**

**Hours:** Monday - Friday - up to 10 hours/week

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Deliver pre-service and monthly in-service training sessions to teaching staff
* Monitor the implementation of SONYC curricula in the classroom
* Supervise all classroom practices - room arrangement, lesson plans, daily schedules, routines, and transitions to assure their adherence to program policies
* Supervise children's assessment, including weekly observations in each area, examples of the child's work, developmental assessments, and children's assessment data entry and outcome reports
* Lead responsibility for implementing Family Literacy Program
* Identify and prioritize materials and equipment needed in classrooms and coordinate with director
* Attend staff training and meetings
* Assist individual staff members in identifying their training needs, and improving their knowledge and abilities
* Complete and submit required reports to the Director office, in a timely and accurate fashion
* Evaluate the performance of teaching staff, at the end of probation and annually thereafter, and recommend subsequent personnel action to director
* Actively participate in the development and implementation of the staff Professional Development Plan
* Assure that files and documentation are complete, accurate, and confidentially maintained
* Perform other duties, as may be required

**QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:**

* Proof of a physical examination within the last six months, which includes a tuberculosis test, and comply with other background checks as required by Harriman Summer Camp, DYCD, DOE and DOH
* Personal qualifications as required by Harriman After School Programs, emotional maturity, willingness to cooperate with the aims of the program, respect for children and adults, flexibility and patience
* Have education or experience in collaborating with parents in the education of their children
* Requires ability to use abstract reasoning, problem-solving, planning, and analytical skills in: training, evaluation, and program development
* Requires effective interpersonal and oral communication skills for supervisory duties
* Requires effective writing and oral communication skills to conduct meetings and training sessions, and to prepare reports that are clear, complete, and comprehensive;
* Successful experience working in a team setting
* Ability to present a positive image of the organization to members of the community
* Manual dexterity sufficient to operate a computer and office equipment
* Experience successfully working with a culturally diverse staff and clients

**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:**

* Preferably baccalaureate or advanced degree in education. Experience developing and implementing curriculum
* Have knowledge and experience in the philosophy and practices of DYCD (or comparable child development programs), developmentally appropriate practice, and bilingual education

**Drug Testing:**

Staff members are subject to random drug testing throughout the school year.

**COVID Guidelines:**   
Face masks are not required but COVID protocols are in place. *By DOE mandate, COVID vaccination and proof of vacation are required.*

* 401(k) matching

title: Technical Writer
description:
If you have a talent for producing clear English texts, presenting complex topics in a simple and understandable manner, and are excellent at simplifying technical input, while being able to develop multiple content versions for different audiences from the same source material, you may be an ideal candidate for the Technical Writer role. Candidates should have an advanced understanding of computer publishing tools and be proficient in using Jira and Confluence. Apply today to become a valuable member of our team!
  

### **Candidate profile**

* Strong knowledge of written English (graduates in English philology or native speakers preferred)
* Advanced knowledge of computer publishing software (MS Office, i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Help+Manual, Snagit, Visual Studio Code (.adoc, .xml, markdown))
* Good understanding of open API documentation
* Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
* Strong communication skills
* Ability to write clear, concise texts and present complex topics in an easily understandable way, including simplifying technical input and producing multiple content versions for specific audiences based on the same source material
* Ability to create diagrams and visually appealing presentations
* Focus on quality, accuracy, and attention to detail
* Experience in creating and editing documentation and technical materials
* Familiarity with e-learning platforms and wiki portals
* Previous experience with loyalty management systems (a plus)
* Previous experience in IT (a plus)

### **Your responsibilities**

* Communicating effectively and conducting meetings with teams, including developers, implementation specialists, sales teams, system architects, and designers, to thoroughly understand Comarch products and systems
* Creating various types of technical and business documentation: user, integration, implementation
* Ensuring that technical documentation—both new and existing—is accurate, up-to-date, complete, and understandable to a wide range of audiences
* Preparing materials that meet quality standards in terms of editing, including conciseness, text style, and use of graphics
* Creating and publishing training materials, templates, and business presentations
* Developing system diagrams and infographics

### **For you**

Salary range information below reflects target base salary. Some positions may have an opportunity to receive an additional bonuses based on company discretions and contingent on individual performance. Actual compensation will be based on candidate’s experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of the offer.  

  

  

* Base Salary Range:$95,000.00 - $157,000.00/yr., actual pay will be based on relevant qualifications and experience
* 100% paid health insurance
* 401(k) match
* Flexible Spending Account (health, dependent, commuter)

* Exciting work in a rapidly growing department working with leading world brands
* Opportunity to learn from leading specialists to develop professional IT career
* Hybrid Work Model

### **Accommodation statement**

Comarch Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital or veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law. * Proficient written and verbal communication skills
* Veterans with an honorable discharge are strongly encouraged to apply

* New York State Security Guard License (Required)

* 16-hour on the job training certificate – (Required)
* Fire Guard for Impairment F-01 (Preferred), must be obtained within 2 weeks of employment
* First Aid / AED – CPR certification (Preferred)

**Availability**

QPS maintains operations 24/7/365 and is an “essential business” in the New York area. We work during normal times as well as when other businesses may be closed down. The position requires flexibility and an ability to work whatever schedule and hours are deemed necessary to efficiently accomplish the work and service our clients, which may include working extended hours, weekends, holidays, and/or during emergency situations, such as natural disasters (storms, including but not limited to rain, wind, snow and ice, floods, power outages, fires, earthquakes, etc.), public health emergencies such as the COVID-19 pandemic, government-declared states of emergency, labor strikes, and force majeure events. Accessibility to answer questions by email or phone during off hours in accordance with QPS’ policies is expected. The ability to work this schedule is an essential function of the job.

*Quality Protection Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.*

title: UES Catholic Elementary Teaching Assistant
description:
Saint Stephen of Hungary School is seeking dedicated, ambitious and flexible educators to join our community as full-time or part-time teaching assistant for the 2024-2025 school year.

Founded in 1928, Saint Stephen of Hungary Catholic School is a Pre-K through 8th grade National Blue Ribbon school with a rich heritage of academic excellence. By nurturing each student's mind, body and spirit in the Franciscan tradition, Saint Stephen of Hungary School prepares its students to be passionate leaders and self-confident life-long learners.

Our holistic, differentiated approach to learning creates an environment where students are supported to take calculated risks and explore the world around them. Students are challenged to think critically and creatively in order to solve complex real-life problems. Working collaboratively students learn to clearly communicate diverse opinions and resolve conflict. Students are celebrated for their unique differences and curriculum is tailored to meet the needs of each individual student. Through a self-reflective process, students are empowered to be active participants in their own decision-making abilities. Saint Stephen of Hungary School provides students with the skills to be successful in our ever-changing global community.

The primary responsibilities for this teaching assistant position involves supporting a head teacher with planning and implementing whole group and small group instruction. In addition to responsibilities in the classroom, this teaching assistant will also be asked to assist with morning arrival, lunch, recess and other duties when necessary.

We are seeking ambitious candidates who are flexible, willing to take on responsibility, learn on the go, and would like to work as a head teacher one day. Candidates currently in graduate school with student teaching experience are invited to apply. We will support graduate students to meet their coursework and certification requirements. Current students of Fordham University or Saint John’s university may be eligible for a tuition discount if hired for the Teacher’s Assistant position. Please submit a resume, personal letter of interest, and contact information for two professional references for consideration for this position.Part-time and full-time opportunities are available. Eligible for health insurance, dental insurance and retirement.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $28,967.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Automotive Light Duty Technician, Repair person
description:
The Children's Center of Monmouth County is in need of ***part-time or full time light duty auto/small bus mechanics/technicians.*** We are a campus that contains a Special Needs School for children ages 3-21 and an Adult Day Program for individuals over the age of 21 years in Neptune, NJ. A High School Diploma is required.

You would work on small school vans, automobiles, small buses, etc.

\\* Perform routine automotive maintenance tasks, including oil changes, tire rotations, troubleshooting, brake inspections, minor repairs, etc.  
\\* Assist in the diagnoses and repair or replacement of vehicle issues.  
\\* Conduct thorough inspections of vehicles to identify problems or safety concerns. Assist with bi-annual MVC Inspections.  
\\* Use diagnostic tools and equipment to accurately troubleshoot vehicle issues.  
\\* Perform preventative maintenance on vehicles.  
\\* Keep accurate records of all repairs and maintenance performed on vehicles. \\* Maintain excellent communication between other mechanics and campus administration.

Other duties as required by Campus Management.

Experience preferred is:  
- Minimum of 2 years of experience as an automotive/van/mini bus mechanic.  
- Proficient in diagnosing and repairing basic mechanical problems in vehicles.  
- Experience working with typical mechanical tools and equipment.  
- Familiarity with power tools and their proper usage.  
- Ability to read and interpret technical manuals and instructions if needed.

We are seeking a part-time or full-time automotive technician/mechanic to join our team. Retirees, veterans, minorities, are encouraged to apply. Our mechanics are an essential part in ensuring our special needs population gets to and from the campus safely..

Requirements include but are not limited to:  
- High school diploma or equivalent.  
- Valid driver's license with a clean driving record.  
- Strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills.  
- Ability to work independently or as part of a team.  
- Excellent communication skills.

If you have the necessary skills and experience to excel in this role, we would love to hear from you. Please submit a letter of interest or a work experience resume for consideration.

title: Program Director For After-School
description:
**Overview**  
We are seeking a dedicated Program Director to oversee and manage educational programs at our institution. The Program Director will play a crucial role in developing and implementing academic initiatives to enhance the learning experience for students.

**Program Director**

Millennium Development is seeking experienced applicants who will be responsible for ensuring that the After School Program meets all program guidelines. The Program Director must be able to plan and organize a structured program consisting of educational and recreational activities according to age group, supervise staff and maintain a high level of communication between school representatives and participants, staff and supervisors. In addition, the Program Director will be responsible for the management of the entire COMPASS program at his/her site.

**Responsibilities:**

* Recruit, train and supervise staff according to DYCD & Millennium Policies.
* Provide reports, update and coordinate weekly meetings with supervisor.
* Build productive relationships with school’s administrative team, including Principal, Assistant Principal, curriculum development staff, Teachers. PTA president and the Parent Coordinator.
* Ensure that all DYCD, DOH and Millennium guidelines are followed and adhered to.
* Responsible for data entry, reports, snack, securing space, security and all other administrative duties/documentation requirement in a timely fashion.
* Ensure that adequate supplies and equipment are kept safe and available for programmatic needs.
* Promote literacy, multiculturalism, parent and community involvement through appropriate program enhancements and activities.
* Maintain accurate records pertaining to licensing requirements, staff/child health and safety.
* Develop and implement program curriculum aligned with school program curricula, including STEM & STEAM.
* Evaluate and document staff performance informally and formally during the program year.
* Serve as a liaison with school personnel. Create a Parent Advisory and Youth Advisory Group.
* Attend school planning meetings and PTA meetings. Develop community relations with other community organizations or programs.
* Supervise the completion, collection and submission of date and reports to DYCD as required under contract agreement.
* Supervise and plan summer programs
* Must be able to work on Site.
* Additional Responsibilities may apply

Deco Planters is a leading manufacturer of high-quality aluminum and Corten steel planters, edging, pergolas and other landscaping products for various commercial and residential applications.

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Outbound Sales Representative to join our team at Deco Planters. As an **Outbound Sales Representative**, you will be responsible for generating new business leads through heavy outbound calling, targeting construction and landscaping companies across the West Coast.

description:
Data center technicians work at the heart of the ReliableSite infrastructure. Building, maintaining, and troubleshooting server issues hands on to provide our global customer base with an exceptional experience. A great personality and a team player is a must.

Job Description:

* Can assemble a server/computer
* Basic understanding of networking (switches, routers, etc)
* Provide support for IT hardware as specified by or utilized in Data Center environment.
* Onsite server builds and decommissions
* OS installation and configuration
* Analyze, diagnose, and troubleshoot hardware/server issues with focus on responsiveness while providing problem resolution.
* Rebooting servers
* Creating system boot disks
* Checking status lights on equipment
* Replacing hot-swappable drives
* Racking and stacking servers and network equipment
* Verifying cable locations and plugging cables
* Cabling - install cables, connections and cross-connects to data center and customer equipment
* Escalating issues to ensure prompt resolution
* Collaboration with teammates
* Special preference for individuals willing to work nights, weekends, and/or second shifts.

Technical Requirements

* Some Linux and/or Windows Server experience
* Demonstrable knowledge of hardware components
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Soft Skills/Personality Traits

* Detail Oriented
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment

title: Dog Walker/Pet Sitter
description:
**\\*Position starts IMMEDIATELY\\***

**POSITIONS NEEDED = 1-2 NEW TEAM MEMBERS**

Hi, I'm Kyle with Simply Yours Concierge. Our company needs dog walking and pet sitting help on weekdays - Monday Tuesday Wednesday Thursday and Friday. 5 days per week - with the MAIN hours of work between 10am-230pm.

For this role, you must have availability for a consistent, daily dog walking schedule between 10am-2pm on a daily basis Monday through Friday.

If you have additional open availability in all other hours of the day, this will allow us to get you even more work.

This is to begin immediately. We need the help right away.

Bonus availability if you're free weekends - Saturday day and night, Sunday day and night. Additional hourly flexibility would be super helpful.

This is a commission pay based position - How available you are determines how much work we can provide.

Pay per time/visit: $12 per each 30 minutes. $15 for 45 minutes, $20 for 60 minute visits, $32 for 90 minutes.

There is room to grow, and we're willing to give more jobs and responsibility for a team member who's up for it. As weeks go by, and trust is gained in you, there will be more opportunity to fill your schedule with jobs.

This is a position with potential for lots of dog walks throughout the day - you must be willing to walk a lot.

You must be willing to drive and have reliable transportation - a vehicle.

You MUST BE a PET LOVER. This includes both DOGS and Cats. No EXCUSES. Prior pet care experience REQUIRED.

**Please follow these instructions below - - -**

\\* If you think you are the right person to join the team, please message me with your availability during the week, a description of your past dog experience, why you are the right person to join the team, and if you are located in the Princeton, New Jersey area.

If you’d like to get a feel for the company, please visit:

https://www.simplyyoursconcierge.com

https://www.facebook.com/simplyyoursconcierge

Please let us know if you have any questions. We hope to hear from you soon.

Thank you,  
The Simply Yours Concierge Team

title: Operations Manager
description:
Jitsu is an expedited urban last-mile delivery service, providing customers with a superior same and next day delivery experience. Jitsu leverages purpose-built modern technology and a gig driver fleet to drive transformative outcomes that catalyze customers’ brand growth. Logistics teams can now provide a differentiated delivery experience at a competitive cost, overcoming the limitations of legacy delivery providers. Jitsu operates in 19 of the 25 major U.S. metro urban areas across the U.S, enabling high-volume shippers to consistently cater to the rising needs and expectations of their customers.

**General Job Description Summary:**

Reporting to the Head of Operations, the Operations Manager is responsible for all operations within the EWR area.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Oversee all aspects of the Carlstadt, NJ area operations, including transportation, warehousing (sortation and fulfillment centers) and logistics, with a strong focus on the customer.
* Meet and significantly exceed all company directed Key Performance Indicators around speed, cost, and quality in order to deliver an exceptional customer experience.
* Recruit, hire, and lead the operation’s team.
* Establish and maintain a safe and healthy working environment that adheres to all federal, state, and local regulations.
* Evaluate the overall operation’s performance and productivity. Identify, research, develop, and implement growth strategies to meet growth objectives.
* Manage customer relationships in the assigned region to ensure successful operation and overall customer satisfaction.
* Act as a liaison between our customers, internal and external key stakeholders.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

Position Requirements:

* 5+ years of operations experience, including at least 3 years of warehouse management, supply chain and logistics
* LEAN Operational Excellence background, training with a demonstrated ability to execute multiple projects systematically
* Robust approach to problem solving with a continuous improvement mindset
* First Principles focus with strong base of analytical skills
* Strong hands on leader, multiplier, and simplifier
* Excellent communication (verbal and written) skills
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software

**Physical Requirements:**

The physical requirements below are representative of what is necessary to successfully perform the essential functions of this position.

* Stand, walk, sit at a desk, work on a computer, climb, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
* May occasionally move or lift up to 60 pounds at times.

**Hours:**

Typical hours are Monday through Friday, 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. This position may require weekend, night, and holiday hours according to the needs of the company.

**Travel:**

This position requires 10-15% of travel time.

**Compensation:**

The targeted base salary range for this role is listed in the compensation section below. Actual salary may be above or below this range based on location, skills, and relevant experience. In addition, this position may include additional compensation in the form of bonuses, equity, or commissions.

**California CPRA Policy:**

For California residents, please see our CPRA policy regarding our data collection practices: https://www.axlehire.com/cpra-policy-work

title: Audio-Visual Install Technician
description:
A-V Services Inc., a leading Audio Video company with multiple fortune 100 contracts within the financial, pharmaceutical and computing industries, seeks an Audio-Visual Install Technician. Candidate must have great customer service skills with emphasis supporting the corporate sector, with comprehensive audio video skills. Ideal candidate would have Associates level college degree in a technology related field and/or minimum 3 years of previous employment with AV support responsibilities in the AV industry.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Effectively prioritize and execute tasks.
* Excellent termination, cable management and organizational skills
* Ability to operate power tools, lift heavy loads and work at heights using ladders and/or scaffolding.
* Demonstrate strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Communicate technical information clearly and concisely.
* Collaborate with Control and DSP programmers in the field to load programs remotely.
* Read and interpret AV system flow diagrams and support documentation fluently.
* Troubleshoot and diagnose AV equipment failures,
* Utilize Crestron Toolbox and experience with Crestron DM/Extron/Cisco certification is a plus.
* Knowledge of Bi-Amp, Poly, and ClearOne with the ability to modify DSP is a plus.
* Experience with integrated telepresence and VTC installations.
* Wire and rewire AV rack equipment.
* Troubleshoot network issues and possess knowledge of commercial IT networks for LAN or WAN.

**Understand all areas of the A/V field, including, but not limited to:**

* Crestron control systems
* Conference schedulers
* Switching/routing/interfacing technology
* Video & audio-conferencing technologies
* Extron devices
* QSC devices

**Qualifications and Skills:**

* Associates level college degree in a technology-related field and/or a minimum of 3 years of previous employment with AV support responsibilities in the AV industry.
* Proficiency in PC use, including MS Word, Excel, Outlook.
* Experience in following processes.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, accuracy, and attention to detail.
* Strong organizational skills to manage and maintain various working queues.
* Ability to schedule technicians in the field.
* Must be available for weekend work one to two times a month.
* Must maintain a professional appearance and communicate effectively with management and clients.
* Valid driver's license with a clean driving record.

Full Time Position has benefits including employee stock ownership plan (ESOP), competitive and comprehensive health insurance, life insurance, dental program, 401k, short-term and long-term disability insurance, FSA, HRA, Commuter Benefit Card, full paid vacations, and paid holidays.

**A-V Services Inc. provided the following inclusive hiring information:**

We are an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or disability status.

Our human capital is the most valuable asset we have. The collective sum of the individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities and talent that our employees invest in their work represents a significant part of not only our culture, but our reputation and company’s achievement as well.

We embrace and encourage our employees’ differences in age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other characteristics that make our employees unique.

title: Part-time Bookkeeper
description:
**Job description -** ***Part Time Bookkeeper***

***NOTE: THIS IS A PART TIME REMOTE POSITION. CANDIDATE MUST LIVE IN NY OR NJ WITHIN 2 HOURS OF NYC FOR QUARTERLY IN-PERSON MEETINGS.***

**A Little About Who We Are & What We Stand For** 

- *Watch Her Prosper* helps service-based women business owners master their finances and achieve total prosperity! We offer a small team dynamic as we provide financial support and mentorship through bookkeeping, tax-time readiness, mentorship, and business growth advice primarily for female service-based business owners.

**Opportunity and Job Description** 

-We have a very unique remote working opportunity for someone to join our growing team at a Part-Time Bookkeeper. The responsibilities of the job are as follows:

-Maintaining and updating books (QuickBooks Online) for service-based clients, who are primarily female-owned small businesses with revenue between $200K-$5M. Will eventually work with up to 20-25 clients.

-Maintaining links in books to bank and credit card accounts, and categorizing transactions (including payroll)

-Creating and maintaining chart of accounts

-Creating and matching payments for vendor bills and client invoices (including tracking of reimbursable expenses)

-Reconciling books to bank and credit card statements

-Troubleshooting/analyzing trends and red flags in client’s books

-Downloading reports to send to clients

-Conducting e-mail correspondence with clients directly

**Who and What we are looking for** 

-3+ years of bookkeeping specific experience working with small businesses and extensive knowledge of bookkeeping and reviewing books through Quickbooks Online

-Your background is specifically within bookkeeping not staff accounting or general accounting for a large firm or corporation

-A Bachelors in Accounting is a plus but not required

-You are able to begin training by the beginning of October

-You are able to travel to NYC to meet on a periodic basis, approximately quarterly

-Proficiency in Mac Operating System, Microsoft Word & Excel, Quickbooks Online, and Google Suite/Workspace. A Quickbooks tutorial will be done and recorded as part of the interview process to ensure proficiency.

-You do not own your own business

-You live in NY or NJ & within a less than 2 hour commute from NYC

-You embrace a learning and growth environment-You are excited to work for a growing, small company

-You give strong attention to detail with “detective like” skills and are highly organized

-You must demonstrate a strong capacity to learn and retain information

-You are energetic and positive as an independent, self-motivated thinker

-You have excellent analytical skills

-You have the ability to track and meet multiple deadlines on an ongoing basis

-You can easily work with and communicate with others that have high expectations

-You have solid and proactive written and verbal communication skills

-You are coachable and open to 1:1 feedback

**Part Time, But Committed!**

-Beginning with 5 hours per week & growing up to 25 hours as desired (flexible)

-This is a temporary position for the first 3 months to make sure you are a good fit for the company and then will turn into a permanent, part time position if it is a mutual fit

-You should want to be a part of this company for the long-haul and are a loyal employee

-Position is remote with in-person as needed (quarterly)

**Company Benefits & Perks** 

-Mostly remote position with some in-person training and quarterly meetings in NYC

-Eligible to contribute & receive matching funds in the company retirement plan after 6 months of employment

-Eligible for annual raises & bonuses

**Salary**

-The training rate for 3 months will be $20 per hour. After 3 months of the hourly training rate, the non-training hourly rate will be $30-$35 per hour on a part-time basis.

*If you believe you are the right fit for this position, we look forward to reviewing your application.Join us in helping women beat the financial odds and become highly profitable in their small businesses!*

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $35.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 25 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid training
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Work from home

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities

Application Question(s):

* A QuickBooks skills test will be administered and recorded as part of the interview process to ensure proficiency in processing transactions required for the position.

Experience:

* Bookkeeping: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10016

title: LPN/Scrub Nurse
description:
We are currently seeking experienced LPN's to work in our surgery center:

Experience in Pre/Post Op care highly preferred !!

Duties include:

* Performs the circulating nurse’s role and functions following approved operating room procedures to meet the requirements of scheduled procedures
* Participates as a team member in support of the total perioperative process
* Organizes time, equipment, supplies, and personnel to provide effective and efficient case management
* Supervises and directs patient care in a single operating room
* Organizes nursing activities efficiently and effectively
* Delegates activities appropriate to the abilities of available staff members
* Considers cost containment by using supplies economically and in effective turnover time
* Assists with supply, drug, and equipment inventories to maintain stock level and availability
* Addresses patient needs during admission to the operating room, with attention to requirements specific to the outpatient setting
* Transports patients to the operating room observing policies/procedures, safety requirements, and patient needs
* Identifies the patient and correct surgical intervention according to policy/procedure and communicates such information to all members of the surgical team
* Reviews patients’ medical records/needs to plan care with other healthcare team members
* Prepares operating room according to requirements of patient/procedure to be performed
* Assembles and provides properly functioning equipment, supplies, and instruments before start of procedure and positions and adjusts equipment as required during the procedure
* Assists with the proper and safe positioning of the patient and prepares operative site as directed by established procedures
* Monitors compliance with principles of aseptic technique according to accepted standards
* Assists with identification and confirmation of operative site
* Provides continuity of patient care by communicating with other perioperative care personnel and documenting records accordingly
* Responds in a timely manner to meet the needs of the patient and physician
* Accurately comprehends and interprets verbal orders/directions
* Documents patient care records and other forms accurately following policies and procedures
* Accurately advises others responsible for care of the patient about patient’s status
* Other duties as assigned

Minimum Requirements

* Preferred 15 months of relevant professional nursing experience.
* Must possess active NJ LPN License, at time of hire.

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Physical Setting:

* Clinic

License/Certification:

* LVN (Required)
* BLS Certification (Required)
* LPN (Required)

title: Assistant Property Manager
description:
We are seeking a highly organized and efficient administrative assistant to join our Property Management Office team. As a administrative assistant, you will play a crucial role in assisting residents with work orders, repairs, and providing exceptional customer service. You will be responsible for ensuring a smooth workflow within the office and maintaining effective communication channels with residents and maintenance staff.

Responsibilities:

* Greet residents and visitors in a warm and professional manner, providing excellent customer service.
* Answer phone calls and respond to emails promptly, addressing residents' inquiries, concerns, and work orders.
* Schedule appointments and maintain the office calendar to ensure efficient coordination of repairs and maintenance tasks.
* Create and maintain accurate records of work orders, repair requests, and maintenance activities using property management software.
* Coordinate with maintenance staff to schedule repairs and maintenance tasks, ensuring timely completion.
* Follow up with residents to ensure their satisfaction with completed work orders and repairs.
* Handle confidential resident information with integrity and maintain strict confidentiality.
* Maintain an organized filing system for work orders, resident records, and office documents.
* Assist in the preparation and distribution of notices, memos, and newsletters to residents.
* Collaborate with the property management team to plan and execute community events.

Requirements:

* High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or certification in office administration or related field is a plus.
* Proven experience as a Secretary or Administrative Assistant, preferably in a property management or real estate setting.
* Exceptional customer service skills with a friendly and professional demeanor.
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Excellent organizational and time management abilities, with an attention to detail.
* Proficient in using office software, including word processing, spreadsheets, and email applications.
* Familiarity with property management software is a plus.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize work effectively.
* Demonstrated ability to work well in a team environment and maintain a positive attitude.

If you are a self-motivated individual with a passion for providing exceptional customer service and have the ability to handle administrative tasks efficiently, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and contribute to creating a positive living experience for our residents.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Property management: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

title: Data Operations Specialist
description:
**Data Operations Specialist**

Chery Equipment Group

Garden City, New York, United States (On-site)

**Company Details:**

Chery Equipment Group is a US distributor of globally recognized heavy equipment and industrial product.

We are a growing and dynamic company with two distinct business divisions: Chery Forklift, specializing in the sales and rental of heavy equipment and tools, and Chery Industrial, offering a wide range of industrial products.

We are looking for a Data Operations Specialist to join our team! The successful candidate will be involved in identifying key products through market research, developing solutions to increase sales, and ensure data integrity across platforms like ERP and Shopify. Key responsibilities include **data cleaning**, **sales report integrations**, and **market trend analysis**.

**Responsibilities:**

* Perform data cleaning and processes to maintain the integrity and quality of datasets
* Collaborate with superior to integrate sales report data efficiently
* Conduct research on new products and competing items to provide valuable insights
* Help manage platforms to maintain precise, error-free data

**Qualifications:**

* Proficient in data cleaning, filtering, and sorting to maintain data accuracy and usability
* Ability to use basic analysis formulas and functions in Google Sheets or Excel, such as VLOOKUP, Average, Sum, and Count
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, capable of summarizing and reporting findings, result and ideas clearly and concisely
* Familiar with data visualization tools like Tableau and Power BI. Capable of presenting analysis results graphically
* Experience in the eCommerce sector such as online market trend analysis, customer behavior research, and product sales strategies

**Pay:** $21-$23 per hour

*Chery Equipment Group is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with anti-discrimination law, it is the purpose of this policy to effectuate these principles and mandates. Chery Equipment Group prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Chery Equipment Group conforms to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations.*

**Looking for a job that's more than just a job? You're in luck!** 

**Corporate Coffee Systems is hiring, and we want YOU to be part of our Top-Notch Customer Service Team!**

Corporate Coffee Systems is a leading New York metropolitan coffee and refreshment supplier which provides a world-class product line and the latest technology to bring that coffee-house feeling to its clients in the tri-state area. We specialize in a full line of name brand refreshment products and business supplies that you can trust.

**Here’s what you’ll be doing:** Reporting to the Client Care Manager at our Westbury, NY location, the ideal Client Care Associate will bring their customer service skills and experience to (but not limited to):

· Answer incoming client calls, take and process orders, and support ACD/Chatlines for prompt intake of orders, inquiries, complaints and client requests

· Assist clients and related departments with order tracking and shipping information, supporting all departments/teams with the order fulfillment cycle, including all order/service-related communications

· Generate order forms in collaboration with Sales Dept. for accounts use of new order submittal

· Arrange service calls and problem-solve client issues

· Research/confirm missed shipments, refusals, mis-picks and returns, along with maintenance of client contact information integrity within the order database.

· Maintain open lines of pre-emptive communications pertaining to credit issuance/validation, backorders, missed stops, today’s install, service calls on hold and accounts in collections status.

· Maintain organized COI department files, updated special handling territory portfolios and auto weekly, biweekly and monthly water tracking account calendars.

· Monitor top 30 account order history for daily outreaches in securing orders.

Our Client Care Department is a valued partner, playing a pivotal role in delivering excellent customer service, significantly impacting our customer relationships and satisfaction. **If you are a customer service Star, come shine at Corporate Coffee Systems!**

**What Else?**

· You’ll need a minimum of 1 Year Call Center Customer Service experience (in a refreshment and/or office supply is a plus).

· Excellent oral and written communication skills, with ability to follow instructions.

· Exhibit excellent professionalism and telephone etiquette with clients, managers and team members

· Ability to resolve low-priority issues without supervision.

· Eagerness to continually increase your knowledge and understanding of Corporate Coffee Systems products, their functionality and use.

· Working knowledge of MS Office applications, including Excel and Outlook.

· High-energy, flexible, self-starter, hands-on, and comfortable working individually and in a team environment.

· **We offer a great opportunity and potential for additional commission-based compensation.** 

· Hours are Monday – Friday, 8:30am – 5:00pm.

At Corporate Coffee Systems, we believe in inclusivity. Everyone is welcome here, no matter who you are or where you're from! We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations. EOE. No Agencies or phone calls please.

title: Sales Consultant Bath and Kitchen Showroom
description:
Dolan Inc. has been in the kitchen and bathroom remodeling business for over 50 years, and we take great pride operating our showroom. Our showroom is geared for customers who would like personal and expert design and consultation regarding their kitchen or bath project. Our showroom offers many vignettes and displays for customers to gain a visual perspective of their dream kitchen and bathroom. If you are looking for a position that will allow you grow and expand your knowledge and provide a stable long-term profession the showroom consultant position in our family owned business may be a geat opportunity for you!

The Showroom Consultant is the main point of contact for customers who visit our showroom as well a key support for our team, offering a high level of customer service during the sales process. As a Showroom Consultant, you will be responsible for delivering a high level of customer service each day.

* Meet and greet all customers as they enter the showroom

\\*

* Disinfect displays and samples after client showroom visits

* Regular attendance is an essential function of this job and must be able to work Saturdays on a rotational schedule.
* Coordinate with the team and customer to liaison with delivery dept. to set up deliveries
* Field all After Sales Calls for service
* Field all After Sales Calls for service and replacement and direct to the Service Department.

* Clear communication skills, both oral and written.

* Professional demeanor and appearance

Education and Experience

title: Harm Reduction Coordinator
description:
Full Time, 37.5 hours/week, Exempt

**Position Summary**

The Harm Reduction Coordinator under the supervision of the CARE Program Director oversees the daily operations of the Harm Reduction Education Assistance Live Safer (HEAL) Somerset County Harm Reduction program, oversees harm reduction services provided on the mobile van while working directly with individuals to promote wellness and teaches skills to make healthier life decisions. The incumbent will coordinate access to a range of services and supplies for participants, provides health education and risk reduction education, and helps to build relationships with various stakeholders. The incumbent will be experienced in trauma-informed, culturally competent service delivery, and engage participants with non-judgement, empathy, and compassionate care. The Harm Reduction Coordinator will improve our ability to provide community outreach education and institute health initiatives in areas of Somerset County identified as those most impacted by disparities in health and behavioral healthcare.

**Essential Functions**

* Oversee service delivery and ensure compliance with the New Jersey Department of Health Division of HIV, STD, and TB Services requirements; Ensure the program adheres to state and federal regulations governing the delivery of harm reduction services and supplies.
* Coordinate client care by establishing partnerships with organizations providing mental health, housing, food services, mobile showers, laundry, and other relevant services.
* Represent the organization at NJ Department of Health Harm Reduction Coordinators meetings and other external meetings as required; promote the Center’s services within the community
* Maintain timely data entry of service information into the funder database; Ensure the accurate and timely submission of all funder reports and requests.
* Identify and implement additional or new services and supplies based on community trends, in collaboration with the CARE Clinical Supervisor.
* Engage in ongoing training and professional development to maintain and enhance knowledge and skills related to harm reduction and the health of individuals who use drugs.
* Partner with the CARE Clinical Supervisor to foster organization-wide understanding and adoption of harm reduction philosophy and practices; Engage in outreach to educate community members on harm reduction and Center services and promote enrollment in services.
* Distribute a range of harm reduction supplies according to community members’ requests; Maintain and replenish supply inventory; Collaborate with senior leaders to develop and implement quality assurance and quality improvement initiatives.
* Facilitate groups on overdose prevention and response, safer substance use practices, harm reduction and the law, self-care, and other topics of interest and benefit to participants and community.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

**Essential Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Mental Health Discipline.
* Minimum of two (2) years of experience providing direct services to individuals who use substances or other marginalized populations (e.g., harm reduction drop-in center, syringe services program, etc.).
* Program development, data, and performance management experience.
* Possession of a Valid NJ driver’s license in good standing.
* Ability to work collaboratively and build relationships with colleagues, coworkers, vendors, contractors, and the public.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Bilingual (Spanish/English), and experience working with culturally diverse populations.
* Advanced degree in social work, public health, or a related field preferred.

title: Recovery Support Specialist
description:
Full Time, 37.5 Hours/Week, Exempt

**Must Be Bilingual (English/Spanish)**

**Position Summary**

The Recovery Support Specialist is responsible for working with individuals in harm reduction and recovery support services assisting them in reducing their risk of serious harm or death while actively using substances while moving toward strengthening their capacity to engage in their personal recovery from Substance Use Disorders and co-occurring problems. The Recovery Support Specialist will help individuals with harm reduction strategies, linkages and referrals to treatment or recovery supports to assist the individual in achieving their goals within their individualized recovery plan. The Recovery Support Specialist will assist individuals in navigating the mental health and substance use system of care, remove barriers to recovery, stay engaged in the recovery process, and live a full life. The Recovery Support Specialist will assist with emotional support for any legal issues, provide transportation for necessary treatment appointments, complete all necessary documentation and/or reports, and maintain a relationship with any legal entities involved.

**Essential Functions**

* Provide peer coaching face to face, in the community, educate and support their safety while actively using substances.
* Assist the client towards motivation for individually based recovery by teaching and being a role model offering support which includes sharing their recovery experiences while individuals move through the stages of change to encourage them in their recovery
* Serve as a recovery agent providing advocacy and assistance for the individual to obtain services that meet their recovery needs by providing outreach and engagement via warm hand-offs in the Center and throughout the community; if there is an opening to encourage them to participate in the recovery community activities
* Contributes to agency performance improvement efforts to assure treatment is in accordance with state regulations and accrediting body standards, Collaborate/communicate with systems partners
* Documents all activity and correspondence in accordance with Center policy, state regulations, and Joint Commission standards
* Engage in team meetings and individual supervision
* Works closely with the CARE Clinical Supervisor on progress towards program goals and to ensure all data collection required for grant reporting is completed
* Engages in continuing education to maintain and develop clinical skills, meet agency competency standards and satisfy requirements for ongoing licensure
* Performs other job-related duties as assigned.

**Essential Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in psychology, counseling, social work, criminal justice, education or other behavioral health related field and Clinical Alcohol and Drug Counselor (CADC) or Certified Recovery Support Specialist (CRSS).
* **Bilingual (Spanish/English)**, and experience working with culturally diverse populations.
* Must have relevant experience in providing services and case management to individuals living with a substance use disorder.
* Has experience in working across cultures.
* Must possess knowledge in formal/informal community systems and resources.
* Must have knowledge of Wellness and Recovery Principles, Person Centered Care, Trauma Informed Care and Integrated Healthcare.
* Must possess a valid NJ driver’s license in good standing.
* Ability to work collaboratively and build relationships with colleagues, coworkers, vendors, contractors, and the public.

**Preferred Qualifications** 

* Knowledge of community resources and services and the ability to collaborate with other professionals.
* Trained in conducting Substance Use Interventions.
* Advanced degree in social work, public health, or a related field preferred.

title: Payroll Coordinator Hybrid Remote Schedule
description:
`We are currently looking for a full-time Payroll Clerk to join our team in. After training, working hybrid remote would become available.

Responsibilities for the role include:

* Produces timely and accurate processing of payroll.
* Individual generates payroll processing changes, additions, and deletions.
* Reconciles payroll totals.
* Responds to all employee inquiries regarding payroll and taxes. Analyzes data and produces reports.
* Checks Hours, checks Manager Approvals, follow ups on question from Managers, checks and closes payroll period.
* Downloads file from systems into Enterprise, Inputs any extra payroll batches, and releases the payroll.
* Processes payroll including employee changes, payments, adjustments, time-sheets, transfers, tax breakdowns, Tax Impact, W-2 impact, garnishments, put together weekly payroll package for Sarbanes - Oxley, pays union invoices.
* Maintains knowledge of multi-state wage, hour, tax and garnishment laws, including local taxes.
* Reviews and reconciles annual computations for W-2 reporting.
* Sends out and creates reports for managers
* Ensures compliance hours and time entry and maintains employee records
* Handles employee benefits and follows up on paperwork.
* Fills out employment verification, handles subpoenas, and helps with ADP invoices.
* Carries out other duties as assigned.

**Requirements:**

* Proficiency with MS Excel and Word
* ADP Enterprise processing or equivalent HRIS System
* Proficiency w/ADP Reporting and ADP Timekeeping or equivalent time system.
* Excellent written, verbal communication, problem solving skills, and ability to keep confidentiality.
* Must be detail-oriented
* Excellent time management skills

**Benefits:**

Competitive benefits available including:

* Medical coverage
* Dental coverage
* 401(k)
* Plus more!

The hourly pay range for this role is $25-$30 per hour. The pay rate offered is dependent on experience.

title: Dog Walker/Pet Sitter
description:
Job Summary:  
We are seeking a reliable and experienced Dog Walker to provide exercise and socialization for our canine clients. As a Dog Walker, you will be responsible for walking dogs in a safe and controlled environment, while ensuring their overall well-being and health. This is a rewarding opportunity to make a difference in the lives of dogs and their owners and to work with a dedicated team of animal lovers.

Ideally, we are looking for someone to tend to our fur friends from 9 am-3 pm (add-on visits available depending on schedule.

Responsibilities:  
- Walk dogs of various sizes and breeds, providing regular exercise and mental stimulation  
- Maintain a clean and organized kennel area, ensuring the health and safety of the dogs in your care  
- Handle dogs safely and humanely, using proper techniques for restraint and grooming  
- Provide pet sitting services, including feeding, administering medication, and providing fresh water  
- Monitor the physical and emotional health of the dogs, reporting any concerns or issues to the veterinarian or pet owner  
- Maintain accurate records of the dogs' activities, including walk times, weather conditions, and any issues that may have arisen  
- Communicate with pet owners regarding the dog's behavior, health, and any special instructions or requests  
- Perform heavy lifting to transport dogs and their supplies  
- Collaborate with the veterinary team to ensure the dogs receive the care and attention they need  
- Assist with dog training and socialization, helping to improve the dogs' behavior and overall well-being

Requirements:  
- Experience in dog walking or a related field  
- Knowledge of dog handling and restraint techniques  
- Ability to lift heavy bags or equipment (up to 50 pounds)  
- Experience with pet grooming and cleaning  
- Strong animal handling and restraint skills  
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team  
- Comfortable with dogs of all sizes and breeds  
- Familiarity with veterinary procedures and protocols  
- Ability to handle dogs safely and humanely, even in situations where they may be aggressive or fearful  
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills  
- Ability to maintain accurate records and communicate effectively with pet owners  
- Experience with dog training and socialization, and a willingness to learn and grow in these areas  
- A passion for animals and a commitment to providing high-quality care and service.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: From $15.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Paid training
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Weekends as needed

title: Regional Outside Sales Manager
description:
Sales Managers-- are you interested in taking your next career step with an industry leader? We have just the opportunity for you. You will be responsible for talent acquisition, developing local marketing campaigns, develop sales objectives, etc.

We are looking for a sales leader with a competitive spirit and a passion for success to assume the role of Regional Sales Manager for an industry leader.

Your specific duties will include:

* Instill and maintain a goal oriented attitude for the sales team.
* Lead a team of sales professionals to achieve targeted goals.
* Develop, train, and acquire talented sales professionals.
* Manage all regionally related customer acquisition and equipment sales activities.
* Develop and implement detailed annual sales plans incorporating competitive intelligence and account profitability.
* Develop and implement local advertising and marketing campaigns to drive new account acquisition.
* Implement a plan to grow market share through relationship building which will translate into incremental lead activity.
* Work in conjunction with the local General Manager to achieve District Goals.
* Oversee performance management initiatives, competency-based assessments using performance metrics, and job function analysis.

**Requirements:** As a Regional Sales Manager, you must be pleasant, professional and possess the ability to function equally well in both a team environment and independently. You must also be highly detail-oriented and focused with a flexible and adaptable nature. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, and active listening skills as well as the ability to interact effectively with both customer and co-workers.

Specific qualifications in this role will include:

* Has a successful track record working with sales organizations to achieve and exceed their sales goals.
* Track record of attaining challenging sales goals and managing accounts within a designated region. Must have used territory analysis to effectively target high potential market areas.
* Ability to develop and maintain strong working relationships across functional organizational areas.
* Expects excellence from others and tolerates no less. Inspires people to accomplish the extraordinary.
* Successfully achieves positive, concrete results through hard work and perseverance.
* Develops sales strategies, techniques, and tactics based on customer feedback and market environment.
* Demonstrated ability to work with technology. Well versed in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

***We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace.***

**The base salary range for this role is $90k commensurate on experience, with the potential to additionally earn generous commissions and bonuses.**

title: Event Manager
description:
Imagine your ideal job. Now add bowling. And arcade games. And parties every day of the week. This isn’t any ordinary office; it’s the beginning of a bowled new career as an Event Manager with Bowlero Corp.

Our Event Managers know what it means to throw the perfect party. They manage a staff of Event Hosts who work diligently to ensure our event clients and guests are totally satisfied with every aspect of their events. Reporting to the center’s General Manager, the Event Manager is a great opportunity for someone with exceptional organizational skills and amazing people skills to match.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES:** ***Get a glimpse of all you’ll experience as an Event Manager***

**BE THE HOST WITH THE MOST**

* Host special events; manage your team of event hosts; oversee all setup of appropriate areas

**BRING THE PARTY TO LIFE**

* Working with the Sales staff and Operations team, help create a seamless event experience that results in guests who book with us again and again

**CONNECT WITH YOUR CLIENT**

* Make a personal connection with your event contact and ensure that all of their guests’ needs aren’t just met, but exceeded; consistently promote this guest-focused approach to hosting

**ALWAYS BE IMPROVING**

* Ensure the completion of all event reporting and use guest feedback reports to continuously improve guest satisfaction

**MANAGE THE TEAM**

* Utilize our client database to forecast events and schedule our event staff appropriately; counsel and discipline staff as required according to HR guidelines and policies

**REMAIN FLEXIBLE**

* Be available to work varying shifts, from weekends to holidays, in addition to extended workdays as needed by your center

**WHO YOU ARE**

You’re an event professional who knows that the secret to every great party is a room full of satisfied guests. Your guest service radar is finely tuned and you impart that mindset to all of the event hosts whom you manage. You have experience leading a team and knowledge of the hospitality industry and event planning/execution. You’re also a rock-solid communicator whose interpersonal skills are second to none. And since events aren’t always 9 to 5, you’re flexible to work a variety of shifts, from weekends and holidays to extended workdays.

**DESIRED SKILLS:** ***Check out the desired skills below and see if you have what it takes to join our world-class team***

* 1 Year+ of Management Experience
* 2+ Years Banquet Captain
* Bachelor’s degree
* Knowledge of F&B and Hospitality Industry
* Broad Knowledge of/Experience in Event Planning and Execution
* Proficiency in MS Office Suite and database software preferred
* Knowledge of POS register systems

With approximately 350 entertainment destinations spanning North America, our portfolio includes renowned brands like Bowlero, Lucky Strike, AMF, and the Professional Bowlers Association (PBA). As a company, we are committed to diversity, dedicated to our guests, and devoted to making the work-life experience a joy for one another. When work is this much fun, it doesn’t feel like work at all. Join our team of over 12,000 associates and experience the fulfillment of being part of the Bowlero family.

The approximate pay range for this position is $26.32-$30.36 plus commission (extension sales sold), (lane reservation extensions sold) and eligible for a quarterly incentive kicker of $1500 (group and lane NPS.) Please note that the pay range provided is a good faith estimate for the position at the time of posting. Final compensation may vary based on factors including but not limited to background, knowledge, skills, and abilities as well as geographic location of the position.

Bowlero offers performance-based incentives and a competitive total rewards package which includes healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Incentives and/or benefit packages may vary depending on the position. More details regarding benefits are available here: www.bowlerocorp.com/careers/benefits

title: Barista/Cashier/Server
description:
We are an Award Winning Organic Vegan and Gluten Free Bakery.....and we are seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic Barista to join our dynamic team. As a Barista, you will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service, preparing and serving high-quality beverages, and maintaining a clean and welcoming environment. If you have a passion for coffee, a keen eye for detail, and a desire to help others, we encourage you to apply for this rewarding role.

- Prepare and serve a variety of Organic beverages, including coffee drinks, tea, and specialty drinks.

- Maintain a clean and organized workspace, adhering to food safety and handling standards.

- Operate a cash register and handle customer transactions accurately and efficiently.

- Provide exceptional customer service, answering questions, and helping with orders.

- Handle cash, credit card transactions, and make change as needed.

- Maintain a thorough knowledge of menu items, ingredients, and allergens.

- Work efficiently in a fast-paced environment, meeting production deadlines.

- Collaborate with other team members to ensure a seamless service experience.
